Ltd., China Steel Research and Technology Group Co. Ltd., Xi'an Tian and Defense Technology Co. Basic stability of commodity prices in comprehensive law enforcement ahead of the Beijing Market Regulatory Authority Festival

Beijing, September 27 (Xinhua) -- To strengthen market supervision and enforcement, the Beijing Municipal Market Superintendency Authority (BMA) inspected more than 2,000 business entities on the eve of National Day.

The inspection revealed that the market sold sufficient supplies of grain and oil, meat, fruit, vegetables and custard and other necessities for daily necessities, commodity prices were basically stable, no serious violations of the law were found, and market operating order was generally stable.

Today, the reporter learned from the Beijing Municipal Market Superintendency Administration that the Bureau carries out "comprehensive law enforcement inspection day" activities in the whole city, focusing on key areas, such as price, industry and commerce, quality supervision, food medicine, business and other whole elements, whole link law enforcement inspection and regulating market operation order.

According to the report, the five law enforcement teams of the Beijing Municipal Market Superintendency Administration, including pricing, industry and commerce, quality supervision, medicine and commerce, work together and cooperate closely.
During the inspection, law enforcement officials examined price behavior, advertising, food safety, measurement standards, and production safety systems.

Market Superintendency of each district also jointly organized joint law enforcement inspections, involving more than 1,600 law enforcement personnel and over 2,000 households of various kinds, which showed that the market sold sufficient supplies of necessities such as grain and oil, meat, fruit, vegetables and custard for daily use, commodity prices were basically stable, operators were able to operate according to the law, and no serious violations of the law were detected, and market operating order was overall stable.

The Beijing Municipal Market Superintendency Administration said that during the National Day, emergency duty will be strengthened, inspection and inspection of the market will be carried out on a continuous basis, various kinds of market supervision issues will be dealt with quickly according to law.
Royal Cambodian Academy of Sciences Confucius Institute "China in My Heart" Chinese essay competition announced

A ceremony was held at the Confucius Institute of the Royal Academy of Sciences in Cambodia on the 26th day of the Chinese essay competition "China in My Heart", the theme of the 70th anniversary of new China.
Chinese Embassy in Cambodia diplomat Zhong Jingfa, Cambodian Governing Council representative and Cambodian Jiangxi Chamber of Commerce President Wei Siyu, etc. presented awards to the winners.

According to Chai Keqing, Chinese president of the Confucius Institute of the Royal Cambodian Academy of Sciences, the competition lasted two months and was attended by Cambodian schoolchildren, middle school students (including tertiary students) and university students (including social workers).
Chinese Embassy in Cambodia diplomat Zhong Fa awarded the award to first prize winner Lin Weicai of the university group and first prize winner Guo Lina.

Chai said the competition was conducted according to the university group and the composition of the primary and secondary schools, and the senior Chinese experts from Cambodia were invited to form a judging committee, which, through the first, second and final evaluation, selected the first prize, second prize, third prize, third prize and 10 prize; the first prize, second prize, and third prize, 10 prize and 20 prize.
Lin Wei, first prize winner in the university group, said that he had been learning Chinese for 15 years and had a huge impact on himself.

Through the essay contest, is to describe the welfare of Cambodia under "Belt and Road" and the traditional friendship between China and Cambodia, it is hoped that the younger generation will continue to build on the friendship between China and Cambodia.
Pictured are guests and winners.

Guo Lina, a first prize winner in the primary and secondary school group, said that as a Chinese overseas, there was a different excitement about the opportunity to express "China in the heart" through the Chinese language.
Organizers said the competition not only created a positive atmosphere for China-Cambodia relations, but also attracted more and more Cambodian students to study in China.

Iran has begun using advanced centrifuges to speed up the production of enriched uranium, in a further violation of the 2015 nuclear deal with world powers, the U.N. International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said on Thursday.
According to the IAEA report, advanced centrifuges at Iran ’ s Natanz Nuclear Facility “are accumulating or ready to accumulate enriched uranium. ”

Since US President Donald Trump withdrew from the nuclear deal last May and imposed sanctions on Iran, Iran is gradually violating the limits of the nuclear agreement reached with major powers in 2015.
Under the agreement, Iran could only use first-generation IR-1 centrifuges to refine uranium.
Other signatories to the deal, Britain, China, France, Germany and Russia, have been trying to salvage it, but Tehran has repeatedly accused Europe of not doing enough.

On the afternoon of May 25 local time, Japanese Foreign Minister Maki Minchung held talks with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in New York, where he confirmed that he would advance negotiations on a peace treaty covering the territories of the four northern islands (the disputed islands of Japan and Russia) and develop bilateral relations in a wide range of political and economic fields.
This was the first time that Mr. Maui had held consultations with Russia as the head of negotiations for a peace treaty.
Maui said to the Russian side, "including the promotion of common economic activity (in the Northern Four Islands), wants to effectively start consultations."
According to the Japanese government, the talks did not discuss territorial issues in detail.
At the December 2018 summit meeting, the two foreign ministers confirmed their intention to speed up negotiations.
At the talks, the foreign ministers welcomed the progress of consultations on common economic activities in the areas of tourism and waste disposal.
"We hope to implement it successfully and bring about the next step," Mauki said in anticipation of the tour pilot business scheduled for October.
The talks also confirmed Lavrov's November visit to Japan in conjunction with a meeting of G20 foreign ministers in Nagoya.
Tuionetoa was elected the new Prime Minister of Tonga.

The South Pacific island nation of Tonga's Parliament elected current Minister of Finance and National Planning, Pohiwa Tuionetoa, as its new Prime Minister, replacing former Prime Minister Akilisi Poshiwa, who died earlier this month of illness.
The Tongan Parliament is unicameral and consists of 26 members, according to the main Tongan media website MATANGI.
On the same day as the parliamentary vote, Tuilagi was successfully elected by 23 votes, defeating rival deputy prime minister and minister for infrastructure and tourism, Seamus Sika.
Tonga is a constitutional monarchy with a separation of executive, legislative and judicial powers.
Tuionetoa is also subject to the king's appointment.
The next Tongan parliamentary election will be held in 2021.

Today (27), the University of Macao holds the "Second Macau Stem Cell Symposium", which attracts more than 100 experts and scholars from the United States, Singapore, Mainland, Hong Kong and Macao in the field of "foreign stem cell" research.

Mr Ge said stem cell research was of medical value and one of the key research projects of the University. It was a seminar that helped to advance Macau's research and development in the stem cell field.

As one of the leading international universities in the West Bank of the Hong Kong / Guangdong region, HKU is committed to building a talent training base and science and technology innovation centre in the West Bank of the Hong Kong / Guangdong region.
The seminar brought together research experts from home and abroad to share the latest technologies that will help promote stem cell research and development in Macau.

The Director of the HKUST Institute of Health Sciences, Mr Deng Xiaoxia, said that in recent years, HKUST has continuously strengthened its innovation and transformation in research and has also significantly improved the quantity and quality of its papers.
At the conference, a group of prominent scholars shared the frontier knowledge and advanced technology of stem cell research.

Ji Wizhi, Member of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and Dean of the Primate Transformation School of Yunnan Kunming University of Science and Technology, explained the process and molecular mechanism of studying monkey and human embryos in vitro using 3D culture systems; Jing Neiwo, Fellow of the Shanghai Institute of Biochemical Cell of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, expounded from single cell and molecular levels on cell spectrum decisions and changes in tissue time and time after implantation of mouse embryos; Wang Yong, Professor of Pennsylvania State University, showed how to use biological material hydrogel to simulate cell microorganisms for survival and delivery.

Chen Kwokai, Associate Dean (Research) of the Australian University Institute of Health Sciences, and Wang Chunming, Associate Professor of the Australian University Institute of Chinese Medicine, presented their important findings.

The Second Macau Stem Cell Seminar was hosted by the Faculty of Health Sciences of the University of Macao and co-sponsored by the Institute of Chinese Medicine of the University of Macao and the National Key Laboratory of Chinese Quality Research of the University of Science and Technology of Macao.

The seminar included 11 academic reports on embryo development and tissue generation, conversion medicine, mechanism research and conversion applications of stem cells, biological materials and applications.
The atmosphere was warm and participants actively discussed and shared the latest research and views on relevant technologies.
Mr Tsui said the seminar provided a platform for exchange and cooperation among stem cell experts in the Tai Wan Area and other areas. It also provided valuable learning opportunities for students.
The ceremony of conferring state medals and honours will be held solemnly.

General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, President of the state and Chairman of the CMC Xi Jinping will award the Medal of Friendship of the Republic and the Medal of Honor of the state to the recipients of the National Medal of Honor and make important speeches.

Speaking at the US Military Academy at West Point, Stoltenberg said: "For 70 years NATO has taken both containment and defense measures based on preserving technological strengths."
But times are changing, he says.
Stoltenberg said: "We are encountering increasing competition.
So now we should redouble our efforts to be sure that no one will overtake us.
"Some of the new technologies were not developed by NATO members, but in authoritarian countries," he said.
Chinese companies are studying 5G networks.
Russia is developing independent Internet and investing heavily in developing the next generation of weapons, such as hypersonic missiles.
Stoltenberg said NATO's future security "depends on the ability to understand, accept and apply state-of-the-art technologies."

On September 24, "A Boat Ticket Take Me Out" was held at the head of Orange Chau in Changsha. More than 100 disabled people from Changsha were invited to board the Orange Chau Star Cruise to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the founding of New China by enjoying the magnificent scenery of the Xiang River.
Most of the more than 100 disabled people who attended the event boarded the cruise ship for the first time.
At the age of 56, Zhao Zhengang was a handicapped person, because his feet were not able to move, he rarely went out.
"Today, for the first time on a cruise, we enjoy the splendor of the Xiangjiang River at close range and feel the pulse of Changsha's development.
Volunteers from the Fukang Social Work Service Centre and Blue Sky Rescue Team in Changsha have provided nuanced services to the disabled.
Especially for those with severe physical disabilities, volunteers will carry them up and down the cruise line.

Over the past 70 years, with the support of the Party and the government, the cause of disabled people in Changsha has been developing and improving, and more and more disabled people have truly become participants, contributors and beneficiaries of social and economic development.

garbage classification education first into Jilin kindergarten environmental protection concept from doll scratch
On May 27, a kindergarten in Jilin City, Jilin Province, began a garbage classification education course, teaching young children to distinguish between recyclable and other types of garbage.
It was the first time garbage had been classified into local preschool classes.
Recently, nine departments of Jilin Province jointly issued the Jilin Province's Work Program for Promoting Municipal Domestic Waste Classification and Treatment.
In 2019, on the basis of a pilot project on the mandatory classification of domestic waste in Changchun City, the province decided to carry out the classification of domestic waste in local cities.
Jilin City is one of them.
Through this event, we hope to realize the effect of bringing children to the family, nurseries to the community, and promoting the concept of environmental protection.
Liu Lijuan, executive director of Hifan International Kindergarten, which organized the event, said.
On the same day, the director of the garden read an environmental initiative, hoping that the waste classification from the children.
After performing the "Low Carbon Bay" dance, the children group started a junk sorting game.
Teachers also issued "recyclable" "other garbage" tags, advising children to stick the labels to the trash cans and record videos when they go home.
Liu Lijuan said that the kindergarten has always advocated low carbon and green ideas, and regularly opened green lecture halls.
Separable garbage bins have also been set up in the disposal areas of the garden, marking the type of disposal.
Teacher teaches kids what recycling is like
According to preliminary statistics, about 546.52 million tons of urban waste were generated in Jilin Province in 2018, and all of them were disposed of in domestic waste disposal sites.
Of these, 3.2929 million tons were sanitary landfills, 20.923 million tons were incinerated, and 801 million tons were treated by comprehensive utilization techniques.
After many years of hard work, all cities and counties in the province have the ability to deal with domestic waste innocuously.

The Jilin Provincial Work Programme for Promoting the Classification and Treatment of Municipal Living Waste at Local Levels, which has been published, explicitly calls for intensive activities such as the classification of garbage into schools, teaching materials and classrooms, and for strengthening interaction between students and parents through the creation of works such as garbage classification songs, ballads, cartoons, microvideos, etc., to achieve the effect of "educating a child, influencing a family, stimulating a community and fostering a new generation".
Data released by Mazda on Sept. 27 showed global sales in August of 117,715 vehicles.
Sales in China have fallen by 21 per cent as a result of underdelivery of new vehicles and reduced price cuts.
Domestic sales fell by 6 per cent and demand for the last train before the consumer tax hike in October was limited.
Mazda sold 17,729 vehicles in China in August.
As of August 2018, sales were down 13% from the previous year.
Sales of China's dedicated main SUV, the CX-4, fell 14%.
The 2016 CX-4 has been on sale for a longer period of time, with new car effects declining.
It is also known to have a big impact on sales because of the strategy of improving brand value in the long term.
Mazda sales in the United States rose 7% year-on-year to 27,482 vehicles, an increase over 14 months.
Sales of SUVs, such as the CX-5, grew in August, a day more than a year earlier, combined with "enhanced promotional activities such as Mazda."
Domestic sales fell 6 per cent to 14,422 vehicles.
The company said the emergency rush ahead of the tax hike "fell short of what it did last [in 2014]."
Sales of minivans such as Demio (Demio) have declined.
The legacy of Chirac's death
French President Jacques Chirac died at the age of 86.
At a time of unprecedented change in the world, the political legacy of this French statesman in office still deserves our praise.
Chirac served as French president for 12 years in a charismatic manner.
He inherited both Charles de Gaulle's independent diplomacy and his staunch support for European integration as a representative of the pursuit of the "European dream".
At the same time, he was a strong advocate of world multipolarity and multilateralism and a politician with a strategic vision.
For this reason, the French press described him as "an outstanding representative of France on the world stage".
One of Chirac's most interesting political decisions was his opposition to the American-led war in Iraq.
Under his leadership, France, together with Germany, resisted American pressure and was at the forefront of the war.
A year after the war broke out, he predicted that the war in Iraq would intensify terrorist activity and make the world more dangerous.
It turned out that Chirac's warning was quite right.

Chirac ’ s strategic thinking and choices in international politics and global affairs are undoubtedly highly enlightening in the present moment when European integration falters and America ’ s unilateralism becomes more pronounced.
Chirac is also a French politician who makes the Chinese feel familiar and affectionate.

He was one of the advocates and creators of the "golden decade" of China-France relations, and after his first election as president of France in 1995, he promoted the rapid development of China-France relations with the strategic vision of politicians.
In 2004, China and France established a comprehensive strategic partnership, and bilateral exchanges between China and France entered a completely new phase.
During Chirac's reign, bilateral trade volume between China and France grew rapidly, and breakthroughs were made in cooperation in aviation, nuclear energy and rail transportation.
Chirac's initiative, the China-France Cultural Year, created a new cultural exchange model in the history of China-France.
Chirac's lifelong affection for Chinese culture is particularly impressive.
According to Chinese diplomats who know him, Chirac can carry some poems of Li Bai and Du Fu and even accurately judge the history of China Bronze Age.
"Not to see the pyramids not really in Egypt, not to see the terracotta cotta not really in China" - this gold phrase comes from Chirac.

鈥淭he West has concerns about China's political and social development, the ecological problems arising from China's economic growth and China's political position internationally, 鈥? Chirac said in an interview with Xinhua.
But I myself have confidence in China.

I believe that China is a country with a long history of civilization, and its experience is sufficient to help it establish the concepts and values for harmonious development and assume its responsibilities on the world stage for a long time to come.
I also believe that China's renaissance will bring new creative vitality to world culture and enrich world culture.
The people have gone, but Chirac's political legacy and revelation to the world will live forever.
The 7th China Computer Society Big Data Academic Conference was opened in Wuhan on Tuesday.

Under the auspices of the China Computer Society (CCF), the CCF Committee of Experts on Big Data and Huazhong University of Science and Technology (Huazhong University) organized 5 guest reports and 188 forum reports.
The CCF Conference on Big Data aims to strengthen contacts and exchanges among scholars in the field of Big Data, promote interdisciplinary integration and the development of the big data industry.
HKSAR LegCo formed MPs to co-sponsor anti-US bill

Members of the Legislative Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) expressed their strong opposition to the passage of the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act 2019 by both chambers of Congress.

The statement, which was co-sponsored by 40 formed members of Parliament, stated that the rights currently enjoyed in Hong Kong were conferred by the Basic Law of the HKSAR, including maintaining the status of free trade port and separate customs territory, and entering into and implementing bilateral and multilateral agreements with different countries and regions of the world in the name of "Hong Kong, China" in various fields such as economy, finance, shipping, trade, communications, tourism, culture and sports.
These rights are not granted by any foreign Government or legislature.

Hong Kong has all along strictly adhered to international agreements, rules, laws and business ethics, engaged in trade with different countries and regions, and participated in numerous cooperation activities in various fields.

The statement said there was no need for the House and Senate of the United States to pass the bill as a means of violently intervening in Hong Kong's internal affairs and seeking political leverage in Hong Kong for its agents, in response to calls from their agents.
Members of the establishment expressed deep regret and strong opposition to the move.
Hong Kong is an important trading partner of the United States and the source of the largest trade surplus, the statement said.
Hong Kong's excellent rule of law, fair and free business environment and clean society make it a good place for American businessmen to conduct business.
The passage of such a bill would, in addition to undermining Hong Kong and the United States' own interests, make China-US relations worse, without any benefit, at the expense of others.
Hong Kong will, as always, unswervingly implement the principle of "one country, two systems", continue to enjoy the rights under the Basic Law and fulfill its obligations, the statement said.
Both past, present and future, Hong Kong will continue to make its due contribution to the international community and to international trade and commerce.
Both houses of the French parliament will discuss immigration policy reform next week, the European Times reported on Sunday.
French President Emmanuel Macron recently claimed that France could not “accept all ” but was trying to“ accept all ”.
Macron is trying to find a compromise on immigration to slow the oncoming impact of the debate, the report said.

In an interview on the sidelines of the general debate of the General Assembly in New York, Macron recently expressed the hope that there would be a genuine two-pronged approach to immigration policy to find a balance between humanitarianism and efficiency.
"If France wants to be able to properly accommodate (migrants), it cannot accept everyone," Macron said.

Macron cited four priorities of immigration policy: granting asylum status to refugees in need of protection as soon as possible; promoting immigration integration more efficiently; hosting and protecting all immigrants who enter French territory; and more efficient resettlement of those who enter France illegally and are unfit to stay.
Whether illegal immigrants should be protected by the National Medical Aid (AME) system has been the subject of much discussion.
Macron said he hoped to be able to "assess" the system, but not remove it, but impose some restrictions on it.
Following Macron ’ s comments, Le Pen, leader of the far-right “National League, ” tweeted that Macron ’ s comments were“ talkative. ”
Right-wing Republicans, as well as Senate President Bill Raisel, also said immigration policy should be discussed in a "softer" but "realistic" way, indirectly criticizing Macron.
The leftist Socialist MP David Warao argued that France should "accept more and better" on immigration and criticised Macron for "manipulating" the issue.
The new Asylum and Immigration Act, which has been in place for a year, has divided opinion within the ruling party but failed to placate opposition parties on the right, the report said.

In the next 2022 election, the topic of immigration policy will again be the focus of attacks on the far right, on which Macron will need to make a difference, but at the same time risk angering the ruling party's inner left.
It has been reported that the lower house of the French National Assembly will debate immigration policy from 30 September and the Senate from 2 October.
There are signs that China's A-shares are in the midst of a wave of buybacks, with many listed companies offering “real gold and silver ” to buy back their shares.

According to the financial data service East Wealth, the total amount of buybacks implemented by A-share listed companies in 2019 was over 100 billion yuan (RMB), well above the same period in previous years.

In response, Xu Yang, chairman of Shanghai Mykorong Information Consulting Co., said the low overall valuation of the A-share market this year and the relatively low repurchase of shares would help the listed companies improve the efficiency of their capital use.
In addition, the continuous improvement of the share repurchase system, also promoted the listed companies actively share repurchase.
At the beginning of this year, for example, the Shanghai Stock Exchange and Shenzhen Stock Exchange issued detailed rules for the implementation of repurchase of shares of listed companies.
So far this year, listed companies that have implemented the repurchase program have concentrated on infrastructure, real estate, information technology and electronics.
In addition, in terms of the amount of repurchase payments, six listed companies have repurchased more than $1 billion this year.
At the top of the list is Erie shares, which have been repurchased for more than $5 billion.
What impact will the repurchase of shares by listed companies have on the market?

Zhao Xijun, vice president of the School of Finance and Finance of Renmin University of China, told Xinhua News that the buyback shows that listed companies have strong economic strength and better financial position, are able to maintain stock price stability and give investors confidence.

With nearly two months to go, the restoration work of the large mural "The Hail Shrine Map" of Tianjin Tianhaou Palace, one of the key cultural protection units of the state, was announced on the 26th, and will be reopened on the National Day this year.
"Ha Ha Ha Shu Map" is a large-scale traditional mural reflecting the life of Mazu.
With the approval of the relevant state departments, it was drawn by Cai Changkui, former curator of Tianjin Folk Museum (Tianhau Palace) from 1991 to 1994.

It is known that this mural, painted on the south and north walls of the Temple of Tianhau Palace, is 32 meters long, 2.6 meters high, in two parts, with more than 30 stories such as the birth and fall of the heavenly days, the flight of the sea, the rise and rise of the sky, 358 characters recreate the life story of Mazu.
Tsai said that in recent years, Tianjin has experienced rainy summers and dry winters, resulting in a “wet and dry ” break in the murals, which account for 60% of the total area of the murals.

In order to protect and rescue the murals of Mazu, the Committee of Management of Ancient Culture Street and Tianhau Palace in Nankai District of Tianjin initiated the restoration of the Temple Hall and the fresco inside.
The restoration project was led by Cai Changkui and involved four famous national painters.

The restoration work is based on the principle of 'old as old', but also the original murals have been partially adjusted, the original murals are not perfect place to carry out supplementary repairs.
In the restoration, we have also made innovations in color, materials, ink and so on.
After the restoration, the original fresco style, spirituality, spirit and artistic style were maintained.
Built in 1326, it is commonly known as the Queen's Palace, and has been renovated several times, making it the oldest building in downtown Tianjin and one of the oldest temples in China.
September 25, Beijing Daxing International Airport transport ceremony was solemnly held.

Beijing Daxing International Airport is located between Daxing District of Beijing and Guangyang District of Langfang City, Hebei Province.
The roof of the terminal has a steel structure with a projection area of 180,000 square metres, the size of 25 standard football fields.

Beijing Daxing International Airport is the world's first terminal with two arrivals and two departure floors — the F1-F4 is the international arrival, domestic arrival, domestic departure and international departure respectively.
The airport is served by a double-deck bridge connecting the terminal building F3 and F4, respectively.
Beijing Daxing International Airport opened its first flights in the era of Beijing's twin airports.

In the winter and spring of 2019, Beijing Daxing International Airport is expected to open 116 routes, including 101 domestic routes and 15 international routes.

This and Beijing Capital International Airport formed a coordinated development, moderate competition and international first-class competitiveness of the "dual hub" airport pattern, not only eased the capital airport capacity saturation operational pressure, but also can better meet the urgent need of rapid growth of air transport in Beijing and surrounding areas, effectively enhance the international competitiveness of China's civil aviation industry.

In order to ensure efficiency and quality, Beijing Daxing International Airport takes full account of its geographical location, airport's relationship with surrounding airspace and operating environment. For the first time, the airport runway has adopted a "all-directional" layout, adopted the world's largest air-tube automation system, and established China's largest terminal control area, which can maximize the efficiency of aviation operation.

For the first time, domestic airports of this size have adopted the national automatic baggage handling and information management system, adopted the innovative baggage transmission mode, improve the baggage system processing efficiency.
Beijing Daxing International Airport, the first flight, heralded the Phoenix display wings dazzling cool take-off.

The new airport, which has created more than 40 international and domestic airports and has a domestic production rate of more than 98 percent, will have direct and indirect economic impact on the surrounding industries and invigorate Beijing's economic development.

Wang Boxiang, born in February 1943, joined the work force in 1967, has served as the township party secretary, county party secretary, mayor and so on.
In 1986, Wang Boxiang was appointed secretary of Shouguang County, Shandong Province, where Shouguang was a poor county in Weifang.

During the five years of Shouguang's tenure, Wang Boxiang focused his efforts on three things: promoting vegetable industrialization; developing Shoubei salt flats; and opening up the foundation for industry.
Shouguang farmers have a tradition of growing vegetables, as well as lessons.
In the early 1980s, Shouguang farmers planted vegetable harvest but could not sell, rotten in the fields.
Wang Boxiang found that the key to catching vegetables is to get good circulation.
Shouguang was the first to build a wholesale vegetable market, opened the prelude to the development of market economy.
Party cadres are going to take the lead, mess up and lose everything in the county.
In 1989, with the support of Wang Boxiang, 17 members of the Sanyuan Zhu Village Wang Leyi and other members set up 17 winter warm vegetable huts.
In the first year, more than 5,000 vegetable sheds were promoted, followed by vegetable sheds, which spread throughout the county and throughout the country.
For thousands of years, 1.6 million acres of shanty beach in Shoubei were shanty beach.
Local people live very hard.
Shounan has a vegetable shed, Shoubei do?
Wang Boxiang organized hundreds of thousands of people to fight a general war, and camped on the barren alkali beach for forty and fifty days.

Wang Boxiang and the leading cadres in the county eat and live on the construction site, like the migrant laborers to carry the cart, wind food, the people see them all give their thumbs up, heart admire.
In July 1986, Wang Boxiang participated in the Weifang Industrial Conference as secretary of the county committee for the first time.
During the meeting, issued a "Weifang City City City Industrial Economic Comparison Table", at first glance industrial output value, good life, ranked fourth.
But if the original salt is removed, the pure industrial output of Shouguang is only 119 million yuan, the third lowest.
Wang Boxiang with more than 70 members of the search group, ran to the field to "change minds."
Coming back less than a year later, the county invested 150 million yuan in 77 projects.
Each year, a group is organized to study in Shenzhen, Dongguan and Shanghai.
There is a shortage of businesses and fewer entrepreneurs.

In 1991, Shiguang joined the ranks of the 100 strong counties, and Wang Boxiang was appointed deputy mayor of Weifang.

He left behind more than 200,000 vegetable sheds, 1.2 million acres of cotton fields, salt fields and shrimp ponds, 4,854 enterprises, more than 100,000 "yuan households" and a recognized cadre of the people.

September 26, local time, the State Councilor and Foreign Minister Wang Yi chaired the Foreign Ministers' Meeting of China and African member states of the Security Council at United Nations Headquarters in New York.

Africa's current Council member Côte d'Ivoire Foreign Minister Tano, Equatorial Guinea Foreign Minister Oyono, South Africa's Foreign Minister Pendor, Niger Foreign Minister Carla, Tunisia's Foreign Minister Gijinawi and others attended.
Wang Yi put forward four proposals on strengthening China-Africa cooperation in the Security Council.
First, strength through unity.

The biggest challenge in the current international situation is unilateralism, the direct consequence of which is that the basic norms of international relations have been challenged and the role of the United Nations has been undermined to the detriment of the interests of the developing countries and small and medium-sized countries, including African countries.
To meet this challenge, Central Africa will need to stand shoulder to shoulder in order to be united.
In the Council, the three African countries speak with one voice, focusing not just on three votes, but on the continent as a whole.
China and Africa, together, will not just be four votes, but will lead others to follow, influence and shape the Council ’ s agenda.
Since 2018, China has established a "3 + 1" coordination mechanism with African members of the Security Council.
Second, settlement of disputes through negotiation.

China has always advocated political solutions to hotspot issues, and Africa has a good tradition of consultation, as well as the experience of successful mediation by African regional and subregional organizations.
Many of the complex challenges on the Council's agenda, particularly the hot spots in Africa, are the bane of colonialism, and some are directly related to external factors.
Together, we should make good use of Chapter VI of the Charter of the United Nations and give full play to the role of the United Nations in mediation and mediation.
Third, self-improvement through self-improvement.
African countries and peoples know Africa's problems best, and Africa has the capacity and wisdom to solve its own problems.

In dealing with African hotspot issues, the Council should pay attention to listening to and respecting Africa's will, should play the role of regional and subregional organizations, and should encourage and support endogenous solutions from Africa.
China is ready to strengthen coordination with Africa and firmly promote capacity building for independent peace operations in Africa.
Fourth, development is fundamental.
Both China and Africa are developing countries, and we must put economic and social development first and support each other in their chosen path of development.

China stands ready to link the building of the Belt and Road together with the AU Agenda 2063, the UN Agenda for Sustainable Development 2030 and the development strategies of African countries to help African countries strengthen their capacity for development and eliminate the root causes of conflict.
We should jointly urge the United Nations to increase its investment in Africa's development.

The outbreak of Ebola in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has broken out anew, and China has been and will continue to do its utmost to provide human resources and material assistance within its capacity, and is ready to coordinate efforts with African countries to mobilize the United Nations, WHO and other countries to step up their efforts and play a good role in the United Nations Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO).
Neonatal families and other relays saved small lives.
Thriller!
On her way to the hospital in a hurry, a 32-week premature baby was born in her father's car.
Fortunately for obstetrics and newborn pediatricians, the relay saved the life.

On the 19th, 20th and 21st days, the obstetrics and neonatal department of Hubei Provincial Maternal and Child Health Hospital received three consecutive day consultations of premature babies born on the road, and the other two were born on the 120-aid bus, both 29 weeks.
On September 19, at 7 a.m., Ms. Cheng, a pregnant mother of two, felt a bit of pain in her stomach, thinking that she was 32 weeks pregnant, and that her first birth was premature.
After 9: 30 a.m., Ms. Cheng packed up and let her husband drive from Xu Dong's home to the hospital.
Not long before the car left the house, the baby was born in my father's car.
Twenty minutes later, Ms. Cheng and her baby finally arrived at the maternity and obstetrics building in Hubei Province.

Hospital security saw the flustered couple and baby, immediately informed obstetrics room, deputy chief physician Zhang Huan and other four doctors and midwife Liu Yanyan with the birth bag and umbilical cord disc rushed downstairs.
"At the time, the mother was half in the car with amniotic fluid and blood under her body, and a baby boy was next to her with an umbilical cord attached.

Zhang queried the news that the baby was a 32-week premature baby, the parents did not have time to cover the package, the early autumn morning had been cool, he cold skin, no crying, limbs paralyzed.

Liu rushed to the deputy to treat the umbilical cord for the baby, Zhang Huan from the cab, quickly opened the delivery bag, with the inside of the treatment towel and the bag wrapped several layers to keep the child warm, and clean the newborn airways (pictured), then carried the baby to the 12th floor neonatal department.
Neonatal medical care learned the news, rushed to the nurse station immediately to rescue the premature baby.

At the time, the baby was purple, asphyxiated and hypoxia, the doctor immediately gave him a trachea intubation, less than a minute, the baby recovery heartbeat, skin color gradually returned rosy, recovery successful.
After being admitted to hospital, the 32-week-old baby was placed on a ventilator, sustained resuscitation, breathing smoothly, and the next day was successfully evacuated.
After a week of treatment, the baby's vital signs are stable, breathing smoothly, have started to nurse a small amount.

On 19, 20 and 21 days, the obstetrics and neonatal unit of the hospital received three consecutive days of treatment for premature babies born on the road, while the other two were born on 120 emergency vehicles, both 29 weeks of premature babies, and are currently being actively treated in the neonatal unit.

Dr. Sun Guoqiang, director of obstetrics at the provincial maternal and child health hospital, said that in recent years, women and children in the province have received many babies born on the subway and in private cars.
The Sun director reminded, the pregnant mother appeared abdominal pain, broken water, see red, and so on, should immediately visit the hospital.

If the baby is born at home or on the road, the mother should lie flat as much as possible, can be under the hip cushion blanket, so as to prevent the baby from giving birth after the head hit the ground.

Wuhan to boost industrial enterprises intellectualization and transformation to give 20 million yuan subsidy
This year, the city has accelerated industrial intellectualization and implemented transitional subsidy measures of up to 20 million yuan.
So far, more than 800 industrial enterprises of scale and above have been collected information on intellectual transformation needs.

Zhang Hong, deputy director of Wuhan Economic and Information Technology Bureau, said that since this year, Wuhan has launched an action plan for intellectual transformation of industrial enterprises to provide free consultation and diagnostic services and propose solutions for industrial enterprises at or above the required scale.

According to the plan, Wuhan City publicly selects a number of specialized diagnostic services every year, through the opening of columns, questionnaires, door-to-door reports, etc., to carry out intelligence reform needs survey for industrial enterprises of all sizes above the city.

So far, more than 800 information has been collected on the intellectual transformation needs of industrial enterprises, accounting for nearly one third of industrial enterprises above the city scale.
Five municipal diagnostic platforms have organized teams into enterprises to conduct "one-on-one" on-site evaluation and project validation.

Zhang Hong said that the city is currently organizing 373 intelligent transformation projects with a total investment of 29.76 billion yuan, Hongxin Communications Hua's first 5G intelligent production line, Motorola's leading intelligent mobile phone production line, Wuhan Siemens transformer digital unmanned factory, aerospace science and technology industry's first batch satellite production line, Hui Sheng bi-world leading new animal medicine intelligent production line, Ebang intelligent home Internet intelligent production line and smart factories started construction.
In addition, Wuhan City has increased financial support for intelligent transformation projects.

These include investments in intellectual transformation of industrial enterprises, based on their actual completion; investment in equipment and hardware, research and development, and soft investment, with an 8% transition grant of up to $20 million.

At the same time, the financial institutions, such as the joint venture and Wuhan branch of the ZZBC, provide personalized financial services for the intellectual transformation of industrial enterprises, and ease the pressure of financing.
Trudeau "collapsed," could he be re-elected
This time Trudeau stumbles out of the hole that Trudeau himself dug out a little bit.
In recent days, Canadian media have been lambasting Prime Minister Trudeau for posing as a black man.
This was seen as an apparent act of racial discrimination, which caused a stir in Canada.
After it happened, Trudeau repeatedly apologized to the public.
However, Canadians are not buying much.
Trudeau was able to lift the stone and hit himself in the foot.

As noted by political critic Leigh et al., since the rise of the anti-blackface movement in the United States, Trudeau and the federal Liberal Party have been high-profile in accusing opposition parties or dissidents of “bad luck ” in this regard, and have repeatedly threatened that“ whoever makes this mistake should be expelled immediately. ”
Simply put, this time Trudeau stumbles out of a hole that Trudeau has dug out of himself.
Trudeau, the son of former Canadian Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau, was handsome young and had a whirlwind of "political icons" when he stepped out.

He took over as leader of the Liberal Party and fought an unexpectedly beautiful battle in the 2015 Canadian federal legislative election, in which the Liberal Party held more than half of the seats in the lower house of the Federation, gaining valuable separate government.
Trudeau came up with a number of bold ideas, such as "ethnic and gender equality", "eco-environmental", "economic revitalization", and "corruption eradication".
In his five years in office, however, he has been a stalwart in almost all of the above, "running high and low."

Taking the issue of "ethnicity and gender equality" aside from the blackface incident, he had previously been "eloquent" on a range of Aboriginal issues, leading Aboriginal groups and leaders to move protest tents to the gate of Capitol Hill on the 150th anniversary of Canada's founding.
In the fight against corruption, at the end of last year, Trudeau became embroiled in a boisterous “Lanvin affair. ”

It was reported that it had committed a major breach of the law against Lan Wanling, a construction company in its hometown, and had pressured the department and officials in charge of investigation and investigation to "elevate" the latter.
What's more, Trudeau turned his ire to the officials who disclosed the fraud – Wang Zhoudi, mentioned earlier, was the first Canadian attorney general to have directly handled the fraud.
Although the case itself has doubts, its suspicion is difficult to clean up.
Many observers point out that Trudeau ’ s five years in power collapsed largely because of his own “grotto, ” and that the biggest“ pit ” is “self-serving ” and“ unruly ”.

Canada's most authoritative Angus-Reid poll data shows that since 2015, support for Trudeau has slipped from more than 60% to more than 30%, while opponents have soared from less than 30% to more than 60%.

Although the other opposition parties and their leaders have done equally poorly, even a significant portion of the electorate, still voting for the Liberal Party, now disagrees with the prime minister, the leader of the ruling party.
On October 21, as Canada ’ s new federal legislative election begins, can Trudeau repeat his triumphant victory five years ago?
The answer may be one word: difficult.
Whether from the enterprise competition level, consumer experience level, regional aviation integration, Jingjin development integration level, have a far-reaching impact and positive significance.
On September 25, Beijing Daxing International Airport was officially opened.
According to the Beijing Development and Reform Commission, the opening of Daxing International Airport will boost the capital's aviation capacity.

After Shanghai, Beijing is the second city in China to have two airports, similar to Shanghai Hongqiao International Airport, which mainly serves domestic aviation matters, and Pudong Airport, which mainly serves international shipping aviation.
Daxing Airport is open to traffic, from the angle of business development, the capital airport is more positive impact.

In 2018, the airport had the highest passenger throughput in the country at over 100 million passengers, but there was still a significant shortfall in capacity compared to the rapidly growing demand, especially for international routes.

In order to better serve the needs of domestic and foreign passengers, such as travel and travel, and in line with Beijing's increasingly open and internationally connected urban development, Daxing International Airport is positioned as a major international hub airport, with plans to meet 100 million passengers and 4 million tons of cargo and postal throughput in the future.
Therefore, the two airports do not overlap, targeting different customer groups, both have sufficient market space.

From the level of economic accounts, the opening of Daxing International Airport will obviously create a win-win effect, ease the tension of Beijing's aviation capacity, speed up passenger and cargo throughput growth, build the capital aviation double-core operation incremental cake.

From the point of view of the users, with the opening of Daxing International Airport, it is not necessary to concentrate on travel to the Capital Airport in the future, but can also reduce the problems caused by too much concentration of routes, such as longer overstation security time, slower boarding speed, indirect increase of the airport and passengers stay in the airport, increase the airport operation burden, through the airport shipping, in fact improved passenger travel experience.

According to the media estimates of the time and cost of various transport routes to the major international airports, such as the south five ring travel to Beijing to open the high speed direct to Daxing airport, the 50 minutes to drive, oil money to and from around 40 yuan, high-speed fee 15 yuan; the choice of rail subway Daxing Airport line, based on distance of 20 kilometers, 30 kilometers, fares divided into 10 yuan, 25 yuan, 35 yuan 3; citizens can also take Beijing Xiong City Intercity, Beijing West Station to Daxing Airport Station in 20 minutes.
In general, there are a wide range of transport options for people to Tai Hing Airport, and the cost and time are within a reasonable range.

From the point of view of trend development, Daxing Airport is located in the Beijing-Jin-Hebei transportation hub, so it is a little distance from downtown Beijing, but enhanced radiation to Hebei and Tianjin, convenient for more people to travel, the economic development of Hebei and Tianjin is of great significance.
In the future, Hebei and Tianjin passengers can enjoy more international air service services provided by Daxing International Airport.
In addition to the new airport line that runs directly to Daxing Airport in downtown Beijing, there are several expressways connecting Daxing Airport and surrounding areas.

Just as passengers in Dongguan, Foshan, Qingyuan and other cities in Guangdong can go to Guangzhou Baiyun Airport via the Guangfu, Guangshen and other expressways, residents of Langfang, Xiongan New District and other places around Beijing will benefit from Daxing Airport and get convenient and efficient air services.

It can be seen that the opening of Daxing International Airport has not only added a few runways and a few planes, whether from the competition level of enterprises, consumer experience level, regional aviation integration and the integration level of the development of Beijing Jingjin, but also has a profound impact and positive significance.
Therefore, for Daxing airport traffic, we need to calculate not only the individual account, but also the overall development account.

2019 Vietnam Economic and Social Forum held in Chongqing Province

At the beginning of this year, Vietnam's economic and social development showed many new signs of improvement and continued to grow, said Nguyen Tak Jian, deputy director of the National Assembly Economic Committee.
The forum focused on the outstanding economic and social issues in the first few months of 2019 and proposed measures for economic and social development in the end of 2019 and 2020.

At the Forum, participants exchanged in-depth views and views on four themes: economic development in 2019 and the impact of some FTAs; some salient issues in the economy of Viet Nam in 2019; outstanding issues in the social culture of Viet Nam in 2019; and projections and proposals for the economic and social development of Viet Nam in 2020.
Delegates widely agree that global economic growth has slowed in the first few months of 2019, with increased risks and challenges.
Trade frictions between major economies have led to a further contraction in global trade and investment.

The International Monetary Fund has determined that, despite the uncertainty of the global economy, in which 70 per cent of the world ’ s economies are in a state of stagnation, Vietnam ’ s economy has achieved many positive results, with steady macroeconomic performance and effective control of inflation.
GDP growth in the first half of 2019 was 6.76%, down from 7.05% in the same period last year, but still high compared with the same period in 2011-2017.

In forecasting the economic trends of Vietnam in 2019-2020, Deng Deying, deputy director of the National Centre for Economic and Social Forecasting, said the country's economy showed a high growth momentum in 2019 against the backdrop of the world economic turmoil.

It is expected that by 2020, the macroeconomic situation of Viet Nam will remain basically stable, the implementation of various free-trade agreements will boost trade development, structural adjustment of the economy and improvement of the business environment will be further strengthened.

Therefore, it is necessary to strengthen the monitoring and early warning mechanism, actively seek trade relief measures for Vietnamese exports, seek opportunities to expand new export markets, and facilitate the export of various commodities such as agricultural and aquatic products.

At the same time, the inflation rate is kept at a reasonable level, in order to promote the development of auxiliary industries and support the development of high-tech agriculture, organic agriculture and ecological agriculture.

Witness a decade of digital China's "cloud rise" in cloudy town - Xinhua News
If the local website forum of 2009 is used as the origin, the 2019 Yuzheng Congress, held in Hangzhou from 25 to 27 November, has passed a full decade.

From the concept of a cloud to the practice of a cloud, big data and cloud computing became one of the core technologies underpinning China ’ s economic development, social management, and public services during the decade.

In 2018, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology published the Guidelines for Promoting the Use of Clouds in Enterprises (2018 - 2020), which stated that by 2020, efforts should be made to achieve a significant increase in cloud awareness and motivation among enterprises, and a significant increase in cloud ratio and depth of application.
Ali Cloud founder Wang Jian said today that data-centric cloud computing has built bridges and opened the way for data to play a key role in the digital economy.
At the same time, China's cloud computing industry has been expanding in the past 10 years.

According to the White Paper on the Development of Cloud Computing (2019), released in July this year by the China Institute of Information and Communication Research, China ’ s cloud computing market as a whole reached 962.8 billion yuan in 2018, an increase of 39.2% from 2017.
In addition to being the key technology supporting industrial transformation and digital economy development, the invisible "cloud" has unconsciously changed urban management and social life.
This year, the city brain, which has been unveiled for three consecutive years, remains a concern.
According to Ali Yun, the urban brain has been transformed from a traffic management tool into a city management center.

Through camera perception, artificial intelligence algorithms, and urban brain through strong computing power, "parking first, pay" "attendants real-time perception" "tourist route design" and other new urban management service functions.
In the field of government service, "one cloud" is used to dock "one thing", "palm office" "palm business" to advance, cloud computing brings convenience to both ends of government service.
At present, Zhejiang has established a unified public data platform through the government cloud.
As of September 11, the platform had covered more than 57 million residents and more than 15 million corporate units in the province, bringing together 3,066 categories of 190.8 million data.

The average number of calls and shared data between government departments in Zhejiang Province has reached 12 million a month, and every time the data flows over the cloud, it may mean that the masses do less errands.
Use plastic tea bag to make tea!

A new Canadian study has found that a packet of tea bags can release billions, or even billions, of plastic particles, significantly higher than a person's estimated annual intake of microplastics, but there is no evidence to date that they pose a threat to humans.

Researchers at Margier University in Canada have found that immersing plastic tea packets in a cup of almost boiling hot water (95 degrees Celsius) releases about 11.6 billion plastic particles and 3.1 billion smaller nanoplastics into the cup.
This amount is significantly higher than a person's estimated annual intake of microplastics.
According to research published earlier in 2019, the average person eats at least 50,000 plastic particles a year while inhaling the same amount of microplastics.

In the study, published in the Journal of Environmental Science and Technology, researchers tested four different types of plastic commercial tea bags in Montreal shops and cafes, opened them, washed them and immersed them in almost boiling water for five minutes, and analyzed them using electron microscopes and spectrometers.
According to the study, they found that a single tea bag released more than 11.6 billion plastic particles, "several grades higher than previous plastic loads for other foods."
Most tea bags are made of natural fibre, but many brands still use plastic to seal them, the report said.
Instead of paper, some brand tea bags have switched to plastic, which researchers have tested.
Plastic particles are tiny pieces of plastic that researchers define as between 100 nm and 5 mm in size, produced mainly by the decomposition of plastic waste.
Researchers found traces of plastic particles in air, soil, rivers and deepest trenches around the world, as well as in tap water, bottled water, seafood and beer.
In October 2018, plastic particles were first detected in human faeces samples from several countries across the globe.

To test the potential toxicity of the plastic particles released from tea packets, the Canadian team placed the water fleas in contaminated water and found that microplastics affected the behaviour of the fleas and caused them to develop malformations.
According to the World Health Organization, there is no evidence to date that the uptake of plastic particles poses a threat to humans.
However, WHO points out that more research is needed to fully understand how these plastics spread to the environment and what impact they have on humans.

The researchers speculate that the reason these tea bags emit large amounts of plastic particles may be because these plastic tea bags come into contact with boiling water and may break down or ooze toxic substances even when "edible grade" plastics are heated to more than 40 degrees Celsius.
Mr Guterres said the climate emergency was the biggest threat to the survival of small island states.
There, a natural disaster erodes the development gains of a generation.
This is illustrated by the hurricanes that hit Barbuda, Dominica and the Bahamas this year.
Approximately one quarter of the population in small island developing States lives at an altitude of 5 metres or less.
Relocation can seriously affect their society and way of life and even raise issues of sovereignty and national identity.
At Monday ’ s Climate Action Summit, small island states are once again leading the world in the right direction by working together to achieve carbon neutrality and 100% renewable energy by 2030.
"The climate crisis is piling up new injustices over old ones," Guterres said.
Although small island developing States contribute little to global warming, they pay the highest price.
Because of their middle-income status, many countries are also caught in an accelerated and unsustainable cycle of disasters and debt.
The world must act, and now is the time to make big decisions and invest heavily in small island developing States, "he said.

Today's high-level meeting adopted a political declaration calling for the search for ways to help small island developing States manage disaster risk, invest in climate-resilient infrastructure and transition to renewable energy; and urging international institutions to help small island developing States, particularly the heavily indebted middle-income countries, access funding.
Small island developing States are at the forefront of protecting and conserving the Earth's lifeline, the oceans.
The latest special report released this week by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change confirms that the oceans have already suffered the dire consequences of the climate crisis.
By the middle of the century, some extreme sea-level rise that would have occurred only once a century may occur in many areas.
Without significant investment in adaptation, some island countries are likely to become uninhabitable, the report warns.
Pollution, overfishing and acidification have resulted in significant losses.
The world has lost half of all living coral in the last 150 years, and plastic pollution has increased tenfold over the past 40 years.
Demand for industry, shipping, mining and tourism is leading to dwindling resources, including the maintenance of fishing grounds in many island communities.
Small island States also face high costs in transport, energy and infrastructure.
They are heavily dependent on some external markets and subject to price fluctuations.
Some States are also working to address the security implications of illicit trafficking in persons, weapons and drugs.
"By solving a problem in the most challenging environment, this problem can be solved anywhere," Guterres said.
The efforts of small island developing States to achieve the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development will provide us with tools, lessons learned and examples that can be learned worldwide. "
He stressed that small island developing States were a special case of sustainable development.
They require long-term attention and investment from the entire international community.

China releases China and UN report on climate change, sustainable development - Xinhua News Network

The Chinese delegation to the 74th Session of the UN General Assembly officially released four documents, China and the UN - the 74th UN General Assembly China Position Paper, UN Climate Action Summit: China's Position and Action, China's Progress Report on Implementing the 2030 Sustainable Development Agenda (2019), and Big Data Report on Sustainable Development Goals.

The China position paper of the 74th Session of the United Nations General Assembly summarized the achievements and development of cooperation between China and the United Nations in various fields in the 70 years since the founding of New China, especially since the 18th Party Congress.
Noting that the push to build a community of human destiny, proposed by Chinese President Xi Jinping, has become a banner for the diplomacy of major countries with Chinese characteristics.

Guided by Xi ’ s diplomatic thoughts, China has taken a more active and active approach in international affairs, making greater contributions to world peace and development and assuming more responsibilities.
China has always been a builder of world peace, a contributor to global development and a defender of the international order.
The paper introduces China's important contributions to the UN in the three pillars of peace, development and human rights.

To reiterate China's firm support for and practice of multilateralism and the central role played by the United Nations in international affairs; to point out that China's development is in common resonance with that of the world; and to emphasize that in the face of the unprecedented changes in the world's history, a developing China will contribute more and more positive energy to the world.

The UN Climate Action Summit: China's Position and Action is closely linked to the nine action areas of the UN Climate Action Summit, and introduces China's policies and proposals for international cooperation on climate change and China's achievements in tackling climate change.

As the world's largest developing country, China takes climate change as its inherent requirement for sustainable development and its responsibility for building a community of human destiny, and will continue to overcome many difficult challenges to its own development, firmly uphold multilateralism, fulfill international commitments and make every effort to fully and effectively implement the Paris Agreement.

China's progress report on the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development (2019) is China's second progress report following the release of the progress report on implementation in 2017.

The report provides a comprehensive overview of China's actions, progress, challenges and next steps in implementing the 2030 Agenda, and shows China's determination and achievements in implementing the new development concept and achieving high-quality development.
The report will provide useful lessons for other countries in implementing the 2030 Agenda.

The Report on the Earth's Big Data Supporting Sustainable Development Goals shows China's exploration and practice of using Big Data to support the implementation of the 2030 Agenda and policy decision-making, reveals the value and prospects of relevant technologies and methods for monitoring and evaluating the sustainable development goals, and provides a new perspective and support for the international community to fill the gaps in data and methodology and accelerate the implementation of the 2030 Agenda.

In a decision issued on 21 September by the President of Viet Nam, Nguyễn Phúc Đình, Viet Nam awarded the Order of Independence to 12 groups and 13 individuals from the Lao National Congress, its organs, its secretariat, etc., in recognition of their positive contribution to the consolidation and strengthening of special solidarity between the National Assembly and its organs.
Vietnamese President Nguyễn Phúc Sơn also issued decisions on the award of the Order of Friendship and the Badge of Friendship.

In accordance with that decision, the State of Viet Nam decided to award 21 medals of friendship and 17 badges of friendship to 4 groups and 34 individuals from the Lao Parliament, its organs and its secretariat, in recognition of their positive contribution to the consolidation and strengthening of the special solidarity between the Congress and its organs.

In her speech at the ceremony, Ms. Nguyen stressed that the inextricable relationship between the older and older peoples had been forged from a long history, and that the good traditional friendship, consistent and selfless relationship between Viet Nam and the Lao people had become priceless for both countries, created by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kai Shan Phong Waihan, and carefully nurtured by the two parties, successive leaders and people.

Ms. Nguyen stressed that, in a complex and volatile world situation, the greater and greater the greater the great friendship, the special friendship and the all-round cooperation continue to be consolidated and developed and become increasingly in-depth and pragmatic.

Ms. Nguyen stressed that the award of the Viet Nam Party and the National Medal and Emblem to the various collective and former senior leadership cadres of the Lao National Assembly was a recognition by the Party, the State and the people of Viet Nam of the great credit given to your comrades. She hoped that all comrades would continue their efforts and make more contributions to strengthening the great friendship, special solidarity and all-round cooperation among the older ones.

Ms. Nguyen stressed that the Party and State of Viet Nam would continue to maintain close cooperation with the Party and State of Laos, carry on and give full play to the achievements of their cooperation, and actively consolidate and promote the great friendship, special solidarity and comprehensive cooperation between the two countries.

The Lao Diet, which has been awarded the Order of Independence, the Order of Friendship and the Insignia of Friendship, has expressed its gratitude to the Vietnamese State for the award of their honour and has affirmed that it is not only their honour but also that of the Lao Diet.
E-cigarettes in the United States have taken 12 lives with 805 associated lung damage.
26 local time, U.S. health officials said 12 people died from e-cigarette related diseases, while 805 cases of e-cigarette related lung damage were reported.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported the numbers and said it had not identified the specific substance that causes the disease.
However, most patients reported having used e-cigarettes containing tetrahydrocannabinol, the main psychoactive compound in cannabis.
The surge in lung cases is known to be linked to buying contaminated e-fumes on the black market.

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, these 12 deaths occurred in 10 states from California to Florida, while 805 confirmed and suspected cases were reported by 46 states and the United States Virgin Islands.
E-cigarette sales have been banned in India and Massachusetts over the past three weeks, and in New York and Michigan.
The Trump administration intends to ban all e-cigarette products other than tobacco flavor from October, the report said.

The boss of a Woolworths supermarket has been slammed as "disgraceful" after the Fair Work Commission found that a 66-year-old worker was sacked by text message because he preferred to employ staff from an Asian background.

The commission said the way Ms Gail Ayton's boss, Jianbin Wang, who has worked at the Wagga Wagga store for more than 20 years, treated staff was "grossly unfair" and could breach anti-discrimination laws.
Ms Ayton told the committee that Mr Wang, who took over the shop in 2016, had been "trying to fire me" because she was not Chinese.

In the case, Commission Vice Chairman Peter Sams conducted a search on the internet and found "a number of job advertisements that Mr. Wang used to post at various Chinese-Australian employment forums."
Among the job requirements listed for these positions are one saying "preferred Asian lady" and another saying "preferred Asian employee."
A third post said he was "more inclined to go overseas [sic]."
Mr Wang sacked Ms Ayton in April this year by text message and later claimed it was due to her absence and the alleged lack of a small amount of cash from $5.10 to $30 at the cash register.
But Mr Sams said Mr Wang's reasons for dismissing Ms Ayton were weak and lacked evidence.
She has been absent for only one shift in three years, and the "missing amount" totals a few Australian dollars.
He said Ms Ayton's dismissal had "in fact nothing to do with her actions or performance."

"It seems to me that, supported by the evidence of Mr. Wang's job advertisements, the real motivation for the respondent to fire her was that he preferred to hire employees with Asian backgrounds," he said.
Under Section 772 (f) of the Fair Work Act, Mr. Wang's actions ostensibly constituted a violation of the anti-discrimination law and / or an unlawful dismissal of the applicant, "he said.
Mr Sams said it was inappropriate for Mr Wang to consider resuming her position, given the "appalling" treatment of Ms Ayton.
He should consider paying compensation to Ms Ayton, who is a casual worker with an hourly salary of $26.

Given possible violations of anti-discrimination and industrial relations legislation, Sams said he would submit his own rulings and documents to committee chiefs to consider whether Mr. Wang's actions should be referred to other agencies to investigate possible violations of state or federal law.
He said Mr Wang had not given Ms Ayton any opportunity to respond to the alleged reasons for dismissing her.

"I think the respondent took an incurable unfair and prejudiced procedure to dismiss the applicant, and Mr. Wang" waited "for the opportunity, which he believed would 'justify' the termination of the applicant's employment," he said.

"He was wrong... the respondent completely ignored any natural fair treatment given to the applicant when he dismissed her, and it is shocking that he was rude and grossly unjust in his perfunctory behaviour."

Mr Sams said that while Foodworks was a small business, "it has to be said, frankly, that any decent employer would not fire an employee in an extremely unfair and perfunctory manner as recognized in this case."
"It's shameful and it's extremely unfair," he said.

China's railway deepest shaft main well excavated to the end.

Xinhua News Agency, Kunming, Sept. 27 (Ding Yiquan, journalist) According to China Railway Tunnel Bureau Group Limited, the first tunnel in China's railway, the Daisui Mountain Tunnel No. 1 (Li) railway shafts were successfully dug to the end on September 27, with a depth of 762.59 meters breaking the deepest record of the country's railway shafts.
In tunnel construction, shafts can improve tunnel ventilation, improve ballast efficiency and ensure construction safety.

"The successful excavation of the main shaft at No. 1 of the Gaoligon Mountain Tunnel will help advance the construction of the underground garage, opening many working surfaces for the late construction of the caves and horizontal guides, and speed up the construction of the entire Gaoligon Mountain Tunnel," said Song Tao, chief engineer of the Shaft Engineering Area of the Dali River Tunnel Department.

Song Tao introduced that the construction of shaft No. 1 of the Gaoligon Mountain Tunnel, equipped with drilled well frame, drilled well stabilized vehicle, drilled well winch, integral moving metal template, FJD-6A umbrella drill, central rotary grab machine and other large specialized machinery, formed a mechanized excavation system, ballast system, suspension system, winch lifting system and other "four systems" mechanized water lines, so as to achieve eye, blasting, ballast, template installation, concrete pouring process mechanization, and so on.

It is understood that the Dali railway east, west to Ruili, is about 331 kilometers long and is designed at 140 kilometers per hour and is an important component of the China-Myanmar international railway corridor.
With a total length of 34.538 km, it is the first tunnel in China.

China is expected to be Australia's largest beef export market.

An animal protein analyst at Rabobank, a Dutch cooperative bank, says China is facing a severe pork shortage following an outbreak of African swine fever that could make it Australia's biggest beef export market.

Following the outbreak, which saw Chinese consumers shift from eating pork to other animal proteins, the authorities destroyed many herds, cutting the number of live pigs in China by half and nearly doubling the price of pork in the past year.
China produces and consumes two-thirds of the world's pork.

China, the world's largest animal protein importer, now imports 27 per cent of the world's pork and 24 per cent of the world's beef, says Chenjun Pan, senior animal protein analyst at Dutch cooperative bank China.
Ms Pan said Chinese beef imports from Australia increased by 65 per cent in the first half of this year, with China overtaking the US and Japan as Australia's largest beef export markets.
Yesterday, the Chinese government said it would release more pork from emergency reserves before celebrating the 70th anniversary of the ruling Communist Party of China.
White Paper: China has always placed its own development in the coordinate system of human development

World's oldest hairdresser dies aged 108 after hair cut for 96 years
Anthony Mancinelli, the world's oldest hairdresser with a gold record in New York, has never retired to haircut a guest daily, but died 19 days later from complications of jaw cancer.

Manziel immigrated to the United States when he was 8, helped clean the floor at a barbershop soon after, and began serving guests with scissors when he was 12, easing financial pressures, according to CNN.
Manziel attended primary school, but did not graduate.
His son, Robert, revealed that his father loved work and people from around the world loved him, but he had been healthy and had been diagnosed with cancer in February.
