Annual repurchase of listed companies reached a record high of over 100 billion yuan

In order to stabilize the company's stock price and maintain its image, listed companies have been buying back shares frequently in the past two years. By means of targeted buybacks, collective bidding, etc., they hope to pass on the undervalued information to the market in order to stabilize the stock price and boost investor confidence.

According to the Eastern Wealth Choice data, the amount of money that listed companies used to buy back shares in 2017 was 7.9 billion yuan, which soared to 51 billion yuan in 2018, and the total amount of buyback implemented by A-listed companies since 2019 has exceeded 100 billion yuan, a record high for A-shares, and well beyond the previous year.

From the point of view of the purpose of repurchase, the company's share repurchase appears to be the same as that of the majority shareholders, but there are great differences in implementing subject, source of funds, use of repurchase, equity of share.

In an interview with the Securities Daily, Xu Yang, chairman of the Shanghai Mykorong Information Consulting Company, said that in November 2018, the "Opinions on Supporting Listed Companies to Buy Back Shares" were published, and that the problem with the current system of share buybacks, such as narrow scope, complex decision-making procedures, and inadequate inventory system, had been remedied.

In January this year, the SEHK and SEHK officially promulgated the Implementation Rules for the Repurchase of Shares of Listed Companies, which have broadened the sources of funds for the repurchase of listed companies, streamlined the implementation procedures, guided the improvement of governance arrangements, and encouraged listed companies of all types to implement equity incentives or employee stock ownership plans.
After the opinion came out, the listed company carries out share repurchase operation, has more applicable circumstance, repurchase process is simpler, share repurchase enthusiasm is also bigger.

Buy-back of shares in a relatively low position is also beneficial for listed companies to increase the efficiency of capital use, thus increasing earnings per share, increasing returns on net assets, and easing pressure on corporate earnings indicators.

Compared with the increase of the majority shareholders, the repurchase of shares of listed companies is of greater significance and reflects the active market capitalization management will and abundant cash flow.

According to Xu Yang, the undervaluation of stock prices is a major factor in the buyback of listed companies, whose share prices are no longer reflective of the company's future development prospects.
Listed companies with large-scale repo behavior at least show the company's development confidence and financial strength.

The share buyback enthusiasm of A-share listed companies has been heating up, as well as normalizing buyback behavior, data show that nearly 1,000 listed companies have implemented share buybacks this year, and leading companies in various industries have become the mainstay of the buyback market.

According to China's recent disclosure of progress in buyback, the company has repurchased a total of 57.59 million shares of A-shares through centralized bidding, accounting for 0.315% of the company's total equity stock, paid a total of 5 billion yuan (excluding transaction fees), and repurchased shares will be fully used in employee ownership plans, including, but not limited to, long-term service plans that have been considered for adoption by the company's shareholders' meeting.

Erie shares have been paid $5,792 million for share buybacks, and recently adjusted for the repurchase of shares, with the original plan "repurchase shares will all be used as a source of stock incentives for late implementation" changing to "cumulative repurchase of 183 million shares, of which 152 million are sources of stock incentives, and the remaining 30.49 million will be written off to reduce registered capital."
Erie shares said the write-off of some of the repurchased shares would help further raise earnings per share and effectively increase the return on investment by the company's shareholders.
TCL Group announced on September 25 that it had repurchased 3.59% of the company's shares for a total cost of 1.65 billion yuan.
The TCL board office told the Securities Daily that buybacks would be used for employee stock ownership plans, equity incentives or convertible corporate bonds issued by listed companies.
TCL adheres to the established business strategy, continuously improving competitiveness and sustained healthy development.

Based on confidence in the company's future development and the preservation of investors' interests, the company plans to use its own funds, self-financing and other means of financing to buy back its shares, taking into account the performance of the secondary market in the company's shares over the past year as well as factors such as the company's performance and financial position.

The repurchase of shares by listed companies, on the one hand, reduces the number of shares in circulation and increases earnings per share for listed companies, is an important boon to secondary market stock prices, said Yang Delong, chief economist at the former Hai Open Source Fund.

Repurchase of domestically-listed companies has gradually increased in recent years, particularly in merit stocks, and boosting investor confidence through share buybacks is a very good way to be positive and encouraging.

Gansu Qingyang: Lake sheep carrying "Out of poverty".
In the autumn of September, the Loess Plateau is rendered.
A 58-year-old villager in the Yimin breeding cooperative, Chavelli adds a last shovelful of grass to the sheepsheaf and sticks to the side of the groove to see the white lake sheep chew.
"Good taste, until autumn and winter full of fat, before the column can sell the good price."
He fed the sheep "special nutrition meals" every day, regularly cleaned, sterilized and carefully served.
Chavelli kept sheep for more than 20 years, until he came to work in a cooperative.
Xavier is a village in Qingcheng County, Qingyang City, Gansu Province.
His neighbors are sheep farmers, but adhere to the traditional way of dispersal, sheep poor quality, small column size.
In June this year, under the guidance of the government, 140 poor people in the village joined the cooperative.
Chavelli spent all day burying himself into farming, for he had been holding his breath.
People who own shares are poor households. They trust their sheep to the cooperative. They can pay dividends or sell them at the end of the year.
Good at the guidance of technical personnel, he slowly learned to carry out epidemic prevention, mastery of scientific feeding, became the village few breeding "good style".
It is a standardized cooperative with 16 sheep sheds and some 1,400 sheep.
Zou Tao, the co-operative's director, said the standardized sheep shed is very open inside and outside.
"The wool is thick and easy to breed, the sheep can't stay in the sultry and humid place, the shed must be built on three sides of the groove, and the fan must be replaced for ventilation and heat.
In order to prevent the disease, Zou Tao said, it is also necessary to regularly disinfect the shed spray, the sheep in the first quarter three to four anti-epidemic needles.
In addition to living well, the "little fat sheep" must eat silage corn, wheat grass, alfalfa and other mix of grass, and have a broad enough "playground" to stretch bones.

The cooperative shall adopt the method of custody for substitute breeding, and guide local farmers to put good seed and lake sheep here, raise, manage and sell them in a unified manner, so as to achieve good breeding, scientific, standardized and intensive breeding.
Today, of the 140 poor households with sheep shares, each with a bonus of more than 6000 yuan, four poor people who have set up bracket cards are working in cooperatives.

From "mountain grazing" to "precision feeding", from "local mating" to "artificial insemination", from "looking at body shape, touching belly" to "Bsuper" … In Qingyang, Gansu, meat sheep farming is not just a change in feeding patterns.

If market prices are weak, Zou Tao said, local leading company Gansu Zhongsheng Agro-pastoral Development Co. Ltd., will buy it at a protected price of 27 yuan per kilogram to help farmers spread market risk.

Xu Jianfeng, general adviser of Gansu Zhongsheng Agropastoral Development Co., said that by providing loan guarantees, sheep supply, order breeding, quotation acquisition, unified processing sales and other services, enterprises are driving more and more poor households to read "Yangtze".
In Qingyang, at least 8,200 poor families have achieved steady increases in income through "joined" farming, breeding of good seeds, scale breeding, slaughter division and marketing.
Qingyang City is located in the north agricultural and animal husbandry fault zone, forage resources are abundant.
At present, there are 913 meat and sheep large-scale farms and cooperatives in the city, raising more than 5 million meat and sheep.
French finance minister says tax cuts of more than €1bn next year and calls on Germany to follow suit

Paris, September 26 (Reuters) - French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said Thursday that France will cut taxes by more than 10 billion euros ($10.9 billion) next year, and that Germany should keep up with France's fiscal stimulus to revive the depressed economy.
Introducing France's 2020 budget, Le Maire said the ECB's latest monetary easing initiative created an opportunity for governments of member states to increase investment.
The ECB cut interest rates to record lows on September 12 and plans to restart borrowing to drive down borrowing costs in an effort to stimulate recovery and boost inflation.
"Low interest rates will not restore prosperity in Europe, and monetary policy measures are necessary but not enough," Le Maire told reporters.
"Germany needs to invest now, the sooner the better. Don't wait until things get worse," he added.
He has made this appeal to Germany on several occasions.
France has already implemented more than €10 billion in tax cuts this year, giving a big boost to its economic growth.
The global economy has lost its kinetic power, and Germany ’ s export-dependent economy has borne the brunt.
Le Maire pointed out that the tax burden on French households will ease by 9.3 billion euros next year, including 5 billion euros in income tax relief.
In addition, the corporate tax burden will be reduced by almost €1 billion as the company tax rate will be phased in from 33.3 per cent to 25 per cent over a five-year period.

Study: U.S. National Healthy Diet Index Grows modestly but Still Challenging
A recent US study showed a modest increase in the US government's healthy eating index from 56 to 58 over the past 16 years.
But when the full score is 100, it's not worth celebrating.
Americans still face "significant challenges" to their diets.

Dr. Zhang Fangfang, a nutrition researcher at Tufts University in Massachusetts, one of the study's authors, said Americans still consume foods that are most likely to trigger diseases such as heart disease, diabetes, and obesity, which are among the most common diseases among Americans.
The study was published 24 days ago in the Journal of the American Medical Association.
The study was based on findings from a U.S. government health survey of 44,000 adults conducted between 1999 and 2016.
"Despite significant improvements, significant dietary challenges remain," the authors wrote.
The challenges include getting U.S. nationals to cut back on snacks, hot dogs, fat cattle, butter and other foods that contain saturated fat.
The study found that people ’ s daily intake of these unhealthy fats increased from 11.5% to 12%, exceeding the recommended limit of 10%.
The biggest improvement in the nation ’ s diet was a reduction in sugar intake from 16% to about 14%, but still too high.
Officials believe that daily intake of added sugar should be less than 10%.

For the reason for the reduction in sugar intake, researchers believe it is linked to a decrease in consumption of sweet soda, but Zhang stressed that sugars are often added to even less sweet foods, such as yoghurt and ketchup.
Adults in the United States experienced a modest increase in intake of fruits, nuts, oats and other whole-grain categories.
However, 2016 data show that these foods still account for less than 5% of the daily diet.

Despite a slight reduction in salt intake and a reduction in drinking fruit juices leading to lower carbohydrates, Zhang said they still account for 42% of daily calories, many of which come from refined white bread and other refined grains.
The study is based on biannual personal health surveys that give adults a recollection of what they have eaten in the past 24 hours.
These health surveys have asked this question twice every few days since 2003.
The government's dietary guidelines for Americans recommend "healthy eating patterns" to reduce the risk of chronic diseases.

The guidelines state that people should eat more nutritionally dense foods such as vegetables, fruits, whole grains, low-fat dairy products, as well as seafood, lean meat, poultry meat, eggs, and seeds that can provide protein.

The number of Americans with diabetes nearly doubled to more than 7% during the study period, and obesity rates have increased for many years – about 70% of American adults are now overweight or obese.
In addition, heart disease remains the leading cause of death among U.S. nationals.

China railway tunnel shafts deepest record refreshed

After more than 1,200 days of round-the-clock construction, construction was completed on 27 September at No. 1 shaft of the Galligon Mountain Tunnel under construction on the University (Ri) Rui (Li) railway, reaching a depth of 762.59 metres below the ground, which broke the deepest record of the Chinese railway tunnel.
Located in Yunnan Province, the 34.5 km long Galigon Mountain Tunnel runs from the west side of the Nu River through the Galigon Mountain Mountains, making it the longest single tunnel in Asia.
The tunnel crosses 19 fault zones, with a maximum buried depth of 1,155 metres, because it covers almost all possible adverse geological and significant risks to tunnel construction.

The shaft is the most important auxiliary tunnel in the Gaoligunshan Tunnel, with the important task of increasing the operation area to realize "long tunnel short stroke" and later railway operation ventilation.
Shaft No. 1 was successfully dug to the bottom of the well, marking the official entry into horizontal tunnel construction of the Gaoligon Mountain Tunnel.
"The shaft is all in the granite strata, because granite strata crack more, can not stop water, flow from top to bottom, basically the depth of water pressure of the wells.

In the course of the construction of the shaft, many dangerous situations such as muddy flooding, collapse and so on, the construction party invited experts on site to take control of the network, more than 20 research and treatment plans.

"When the maximum amount of water is poured in the shaft, it reaches more than 300 cubic meters per hour, 700 meters deep at the bottom of the well, and the pressure is equivalent to 700 meters deep at the bottom of the sea.
"If you don't drain in time, you'll flood 10 meters in an hour, and we spend almost 85 percent of our time trying to clean the water, and 15 percent of our time digging," he said.

In order to overcome the geological problems such as longitudinal throttle development, muddy inrush and water-rich granite, the tunnel construction adopts a combination of "exploration, injection and excavation" system to treat water and reduce construction risk.
After many improvements, shaft No. 1 has formed mechanized pipeline such as excavation system, ballast system, suspension system, winch lifting system, and so on.
Eventually, after more than 1,200 days of day and night work, the shaft was successfully dug at a depth of 762.59 m.
The railway is 330 km long and is an important component of the China-Myanmar international corridor and an important transportation infrastructure for carrying out the "Belt, Road" construction.

When completed, the travel time between Dali and Ruili will be reduced from six hours on the current highway to two hours, which will greatly improve the transportation pattern in the western Yunnan region, and will promote China's trade and economic cooperation with South Asian countries and friendly people-to-people exchanges.

British tourist car keys fall into lake as family stranded in France for five days
A couple in England and Wales have taken their two children to France on holiday after accidentally dropping car keys into a lake, forcing the family to wait five days to get the car maker's new key.
The couple then left France with their children.
On September 16, local time, the British family was visiting a lake in France when their daughter accidentally knocked a leather bag over and the car keys fell into the lake.
But they took hours and failed to find the keys.
And all their belongings and cash are locked in the car.
Although British tourists bought insurance before departure, the insurer refused to help on the grounds that the vehicle was not in danger of being stolen.
They had to hire a trailer to pull the car to a garage for storage and reorder the keys from the carmaker.
A few days later, the British tourist finally got the key to the makeover and the couple left France with their children.
Their scheduled trip was cancelled due to the loss of the car keys.

Pilot delivery system in areas such as low-risk food production licenses, and delegation of authority to self-trade areas by representative offices of foreign enterprises

On May 27, the Shanghai Municipal Market Supervisory Authority signed a memorandum of work with the Pudong New Area Government, which introduced 20 measures for the reform of market supervision, some of which are pilot measures in China.

According to the introduction, notification of commitment means that when administrative organs handle the relevant licensing matters, they notify the applicant in written form of the conditions and requirements stipulated by laws and regulations.
After the applicant has signed the undertaking, the administrative organ may handle it directly.

According to the MOU, the regulatory authorities of the Shanghai market will support the Pudong New Area and the Shanghai Free Trade Pilot Area in registering the names of enterprises, processing licenses for the production of foodstuffs of simple process and low-risk varieties, as well as the approval of some measuring instruments, in three fields, so as to inform the commitment system on a pilot basis so as to make it easier for enterprises to access.
Shanghai Shaowansheng Food Co. Ltd. became the first enterprise to enjoy the dividend of the pilot by notifying the promised way to obtain the "Food Production License" on the spot.

Business leaders say food permits can also be obtained on the spot, and have adopted a "tolerance approach" whereby companies are allowed to submit part of their materials within the time limit agreed upon in the letter of commitment, “effectively feeling the convenience of reform. ”
The Shanghai market regulatory authority said that the implementation of the notice of commitment system for food production licenses is the first pilot in the country.

After the reform, the examination and approval process was reduced from the previous six links of "registration, acceptance, on-site verification, sample inspection, material examination, examination and approval of certificates" to three links of "registration, acceptance and examination and approval of certificates".

Considering the high extroversion of the Pudong economy, the regulatory department of the Shanghai market has delegated the registration authority of permanent representative offices of foreign (regional) enterprises to the Shanghai Free Trade Area, which is convenient for enterprises to handle in close proximity.
Statistics show that the delegation of authority involved 1,592 permanent representative offices in Shanghai Free Trade Zone, 99 of which have been handled according to the new regulations.

Chinese students can apply for German undergraduate courses starting next year

Starting in 2020, Chinese high school graduates can apply directly for German undergraduate degrees on the basis of their academic qualifications and do not need to enrol first at a national university, the Anabin database, which assesses and certifies foreign academic qualifications, said.

Prior to this, Chinese high school graduates who wanted to apply to German universities were required to study for one semester (211,985 universities) or three semesters (ordinary) at home, and pass the APS examination or TestAS examination.
The new rules may save at least half a year for Chinese students willing to study in Germany.
It is understood the new rules will come into force in the second half of 2019.

Applicants are required to: complete 12 years of compulsory education and obtain a senior high school diploma; participate in the collegiate, college-level, and college-level examinations with scores above 70% of the total score (above 525 if the total score is 750) and include requirements such as two language grades and one mathematics or natural sciences grade.
In addition, the requirements of specific specialties for entrance examinations vary.

For example, to apply for a major in medicine, oral medicine, veterinary medicine, pharmacy, etc., a score of 80% is required, and the subject must include at least two subjects in mathematics, physics, chemistry, biology, or integration; to apply for a major in law, a score of 80% is required, and the subject must include at least two subjects in a foreign language, history, geography, or in an ensemble.

State Council Information Office releases White Paper on China and the World in a New Era
On the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, the State Council Information Office issued a white paper on "China and the World in a New Era".

Xu Lun, vice-minister of the State Council and director of the State Council Information Office, said that the white paper focused on issues such as "where China comes from and where it goes", "what kind of world China promotes", "how developed China gets along with the world", "how developed China gets along with the world," and systematically introduced China's development achievements, road of development, development direction, and elaborated China's relations with the world in order to enhance the international community's understanding and understanding of China's development.

The white paper points out that over the past 70 years, under the leadership of the Communist Party of China (CPC), China has undergone sweeping changes and created a miracle of development unprecedented in the history of mankind.
The white paper introduces the tremendous achievements, significance and world contribution of China's development over the past 70 years through lots of data and facts.

The white paper points out that China has gone through the centuries of development of the developed countries in a few decades, the economy is the second largest in the world, and nearly 1.4 billion people have lifted themselves out of material shortages, reached a well-off level and enjoyed unprecedented dignity and rights.
In the past 70 years, China has developed in its interaction with the rest of the world, embraced the world, studied the world and contributed to it.

The white paper points out that the fundamental reason for China's success in development over the past 70 years is that, under the leadership of the CPC, the Chinese people have found the correct path of development of socialism with Chinese characteristics and have unswervingly followed it.

The white paper emphasizes that the road of socialism with Chinese characteristics is a road established from the national conditions of China, a road that puts the interests of the people first, a road of reform and innovation, a road that seeks common development in opening up, and a road of comprehensive rule of law.
This road of China's development, conforming to China's national conditions and meeting the requirements of the times, will show bright development prospects as the times advance.

In response to the international community's concern for China's development, the white paper emphasizes that it is both the dream of the Chinese people and the common dream of the people of all countries to achieve national prosperity and strength, national revitalization and people's happiness.

The white paper points out that China is the main stabilizer and engine of world economic growth, opening up to the outside world in all directions will create more opportunities for the development of all countries, provide more public goods to the international community, and provide experience and lessons for other developing countries.

Faced with the question of "what happens to the world and what to do about it", the white paper points out that the world today is in a century of unprecedented changes, and that human society is both hopeful and full of challenges.
China has set out to build a community of mankind's destiny, opening up a new road of development with win-win cooperation and sharing, and providing new options for human development.

The white paper calls on all countries to unite to build a new type of international relations, promote a new type of economic globalization, safeguard the international system with the United Nations at its core, promote exchanges and mutual learning among civilizations, and jointly promote the building of a community of human destiny and a better world.
With the increasing development of China, the international community is concerned about how the developed China can get along with the world.
The white paper points out that China's development cannot be separated from the rest of the world.

China has always placed its own development in the coordinate system of human development, adhered to the principle of win-win cooperation and common development, upheld and promoted economic globalization, actively developed global partnership, firmly supported multilateralism, upheld international equity and justice, promoted joint efforts for high-quality development of the Belt and Road, actively participated in leading the reform and construction of the global governance system, and always acted as a builder of world peace, a contributor to global development and a defender of international order.
At present, China has entered a new era of development.

The white paper states that, in the new era, China's determination to follow the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics will not change, that its determination to learn from each other and cooperate with other countries will not change, and that its determination to walk hand in hand with the world will not change.
The white paper concludes that, in today's world, the futures of nations have never been so closely linked.
The white paper "China and the World in a New Era" consists of a foreword, text and concluding remarks.

The white paper is published in eight languages: Chinese, English, French, Russian, German, Spanish, American and Japanese, and is published by People's Publishing House and Foreign Language Publishing House respectively.

Hunting of wild animals by a villager in Baokang County, Hubei Province, was ordered to "tour the mountains of duty"
A villager in Baokang County, Hubei Province, was sentenced for hunting wildlife and ordered to pay compensation of 15,420 yuan (RMB) for environmental damage.

Due to the indigence of the defendant's family, the procuratorial authorities introduced the cost of compensating ecological rehabilitation for alternative labor, thus achieving the organic unification of legal and social effects.

Wang Zhongliang, Solicitor-General of the Public Prosecutor's Office of Baokang County, said that through three months of "compulsory mountain patrol" and other alternative labor, the accused Zhou Mou has established a deep affection with wild macaques, and deeply blamed the previous hunting of animals.

On June 21 of this year, a case brought by the Baokang County Public Prosecutor's Office in the field of ecological resources was brought before the county court for public prosecution and handed down in court.

The defendant Zhou Mou was sentenced to three years in prison, suspended for four years and fined 3000 yuan, and ordered to pay compensation for environmental damage and repair of ecological resources 15,420 yuan.
In late January 2014, Chow began to build a power grid at the cliff, hunting more than 20 wild animals, including gazelle, suede and woolly deer.
It is listed on the National Landscape Wildlife Conservation List as a national species of endangered wildlife.
During the trial, Zhou pleaded guilty to his wrongful facts and conduct and was willing to bear incidental civil liability.

However, in view of the poor economic situation of Zhou's family, the local village committee, forest station and Zhou Mou agreed on an alternative labor compensation ecological restoration fee under the coordination of the Baokang County Public Prosecutor's Office: that is, Zhou Mou provided public welfare labor service to compensate the ecological restoration cost by carrying out domestication and conservatory work, compulsory mountain patrol and forest protection in the village macaque protected area for one year.

The court accepted the prosecutor's proposal, agreed to the implementation of Zhou's suspended sentence, while actively fulfilling the "alternative labor compensation ecological repair costs" obligation.
At present, Zhou Mou has been engaged in compulsory labor in the macaque protected area for 3 months.

In recent years, the Baokang County Public Prosecutor's Office has incorporated procuratorial functions and social governance behaviors organically in practice, scientifically applied procuratorial advice, investigation supervision and litigation supervision, and used judicial means to minimize the damage caused to the ecological environment by criminal acts.
UN awards Earthguard award for Ant Forest

To loud applause and loud music, Xu Piao, project director of Ant Forest, and user representative Shen Junliang took the podium and took the 2019 United Nations Champions of the Earth award from the moderator.

The Ant Forest project, which uses small mobile phones to bring hundreds of millions of people into action for the environment, was awarded the Inspiration and Action Award at the 2019 Champions of the Earth Awards ceremony in New York City.
A week ago, the United Nations Environment Programme announced the winners at its headquarters in Nairobi, Kenya, but those attending the ceremony were still excited.

"Ant Forest is an exciting innovation that has hundreds of millions of people moving to understand the environmental challenges that humans face and what they can do for the environment," UNEP Executive Director Yin Anson told Xinhua in an interview.
It uses technology to connect people and the environment so that every individual can participate in actions to protect the planet, which will have a huge impact.

"Ant Forest" was launched on Alipay platform in August 2016 by the Chinese ant financial services group (known as Ant Gold Clothing), where users save "green energy" in mobile phones by documenting their daily green trips, paying for utilities, and other low-carbon actions.
Each time users grow a virtual tree, Ant Forest and Public Interest Partners plant a real tree in a desert area.
By August this year, 500 million users of ant forests had reduced carbon emissions by 7.92 million tons and planted 122 million trees in desertified areas.

Costa Rica's national environmental effort won the Defenders of the Earth award, and Costa Rican President Carlos Alvarado praised the contribution of the Ant Forest, "inspiring so many people to take part in green action."
Ji Xiandong, chairman and chief executive, said the Earthguard Award was an affirmation of the ant forest project.
Technology and open platforms make it possible for everyone to participate in a low-carbon life, an honour that belongs to all participants.
'Ant forests have affected 500 million people in the past three years, and the goal for the next three years is to engage 1 billion people around the world in low-carbon actions, 'he said.
While combating desertification and protecting the environment, they are also exploring how farmers' incomes can be more derived from green and green water.
In addition to providing employment opportunities through tree planting, it is hoped to help farmers to increase their incomes through agricultural development projects and electric platforms.
"Ant Forest" created based on digital technology of the public good environmental model also successfully out to sea, by other countries to learn.
In June, GCash, the Philippines' largest electronic wallet, launched the Philippine version of Ant Forest, encouraging Filipino users to better protect the environment through low-carbon living.

GCash will join forces with the Philippine Ministry of Environment and Natural Resources and the environmental public interest group to plant 365,000 trees in the Philippines within a year of the project.
The Champions of the Earth Award, the highest award in the United Nations environmental field, is awarded annually.

The Green Innovation Project from China won the Inspiration and Action Award for the third year in a row, after China's Sekhanba Forest Builder, China's Qiancun Demonstration and Wancun Improvement Project in Zhejiang Province.
Economic frictions affect the US economy "report card."

The US economy ’ s “report card ” for the second quarter of this year showed a marked slowdown in gross domestic product growth from the previous quarter, driven by a sharp drop in private sector investment and exports.
Analysts note that economic and trade frictions and the uncertainty they create are the main reasons for the decline in private sector investment and exports in the second quarter.

The final revised figures, released by the Commerce Department on Tuesday, show that US GDP grew by 2% annually in the second quarter, the same as the previous revised figures, but significantly less than 3.1% in the first quarter.
Consumer growth was the main driver of U.S. economic growth in the second quarter, data show.
Consumer spending, which accounts for about 70% of the US economy, grew 4.6% in the current quarter, driving 3.03% growth.
Moreover, government consumer spending and investment contributed 0.82 percentage points to economic growth.

In the second quarter, however, private sector investment fell 6.3% from the previous quarter, dragging 1.16 percentage points off the economy ’ s growth; exports fell 5.7% from the previous quarter, and net exports dragged on 0.68 percentage points.

Barry Knapp, managing partner at Ainslie Macroeconomic Consulting in the US, said private sector investment had not been able to sustain last year's growth, but had fallen sharply, as rising economic and trade frictions and uncertainty hit business confidence.
Mr Knapp believes US corporate capital spending is still expected to slide next year amid policy uncertainty.

Analysts believe that while consumer growth has underpinned the economy in the second quarter, there are growing signs that economic frictions and their uncertainty have affected consumer confidence and adversely affected the outlook for US consumption.

In the latest survey, 38% of consumers spontaneously mentioned the negative impact of tariffs on the U.S. economy, a year-and-a-half high, said Richard Curtin, a professor of economics at the University of Michigan.
Analysts generally agree that the U.S. economy will continue to slow in the future.
But experts say both the US industrial sector and financial markets will improve if economic and trade frictions are eased.
Kathryn Birch, global economist at the British Economist thinktank, expects the US economy to continue its downward trend so far this year, at a slower pace than in the second quarter.

Moody ’ s Analytics chief economist Mark Zandi predicts that, assuming that economic frictions do not continue to escalate, the US economy will grow by 2.3% this year and slow further to 1.6% next year.

Ellen Hartzen, investment manager at Putnam Investment, points out that the biggest concern for companies today is economic and trade disputes and the uncertainty they bring. If they are resolved, uncertainty will decrease significantly and the industry will perform much better.
Miller-Tabak Asset Management equity strategist Matt Melley said economic and trade frictions remain the "top issue" and are the main cause of this year's volatility in US capital markets.

Safeguarding women's legitimate rights and interests is an expression of respect for and protection of human rights and an important symbol of the progress of social civilization.

On September 27, at the 15th meeting of the Standing Committee of the 12th Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region, the Regulations on the Protection of Women's Rights and Interests in Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region were approved by a high vote.
This is the first provincial local regulation to be enacted in Ningxia to protect the legitimate rights and interests of women in a comprehensive and systematic way.

It is understood that the Regulations adopted in 2007 were revised on the basis of the Measures for the Implementation of the Law of the People's Republic of China on the Protection of the Rights and Interests of Women in Ningxia. They are divided into 9 chapters and 65, including General Provisions, Political Rights, Cultural Education Rights and Interests, Labor and Social Security Rights and Interests, Property Rights and Interests, Personal Rights, Marital Rights and Rights, Legal Liability, and Supplementary Provisions.
In the Ordinance, Ningxia encouraged the exploration of joint parental leave for couples, which is the first in the country.

In April this year, the Office of the State Council issued the Guidance on Promoting the Development of Care Services for Infants and Young Children up to the age of 3, which describes joint parenting.

In the process of amending the Regulations, Ningxia made an innovative proposal to "encourage employers to grant 10 days' joint parental leave each year to couples with children between the ages of zero and three, in accordance with the laws and regulations."
At the same time, the Regulations highlight anti-sexual harassment and the protection of female minors.

Article 43 of the Regulations incorporates the latest legislative achievements in the current compilation of personal rights in China's Civil Code, and defines the constituent elements of sexual harassment and the body and mechanism for combating sexual harassment.

Article 44 of the Regulations specifically prohibits the occurrence of serious sexual assaults against girls and requires educational institutions to carry out relevant education, protection and prevention work, thus becoming a new marker for the protection of girls in local legislation.

With regard to women's right to know and dispose of joint matrimonial and family property, article 35 of the Regulations clearly provides that women's right to know about joint matrimonial property and the obligations of property registration agencies and related subjects provide solid institutional support for women's rights.

In addition, in response to the issue of gender discrimination in employment, article 26 of the Regulations prohibits not only direct discrimination, but also indirect discrimination, and draws on recent joint interviews and practical experience to strengthen the discipline of gender-discriminatory offences and to strengthen the protection of women's legitimate rights and interests.

In recent years, the Ningxia Women's Federation has made remarkable achievements in promoting and introducing social professional forces to take part in the mediation of disputes over marriage and family and the fight against domestic violence.

The Regulations summarize and promote this issue. A number of laws encourage the mobilization of social forces and the accumulation of social resources to jointly safeguard women's rights and interests, and require people's governments at and above the county level to provide stable and institutional safeguards and support by purchasing services.

After marathon debate and weeks of protests, the new Australian state passed the abortion legalisation bill on September 26, local time, Ausgrid reported.

It is understood the bill has sparked political debate over the past eight weeks and has seen serious divisions within the Australian Liberal Party since independent MP Greenwich announced its introduction.
After nearly 40 hours of discussion, the Australian Senate passed the abortion legalization bill by 26 votes to 14 on the night, making it the third-longest bill in the NSW Senate, the report said.
26, the morning after a final vote in the new state House of Representatives to legalize abortion in the new state.
The bill allows a woman to terminate her pregnancy at 22 weeks of pregnancy if two doctors agree, and also allows a woman to have an abortion later in pregnancy.

The Senate passed an amendment on the night that doctors could seek advice from a multidisciplinary panel of the Hospital Advisory Committee before performing abortions on women after 22 weeks of pregnancy.
In addition, amendments passed by the Senate include that doctors must provide appropriate care for babies who survive after termination of pregnancy.

Previously, New State Gov. Terry McAuliffe faced public criticism from conservatives over the bill, and she stepped in several times to get more debate time for the bill, but she did not attend the final vote.
Berejiklian defended his absentee ballot, saying, "I need to take the time to run the entire new state."
Australian Liberal MP David Davis is known to have been the most vocal opponent of the abortion bill, threatening to quit the new state government and calling it a "government crisis."
But then Davis made a concession.
"The content of the amendments to the bill to decriminalize abortion, which was submitted to the House on the morning of 26, actually provides additional safeguards for women, doctors," Davis said.
Meanwhile, Australian NSW State Party leader Barry LaRue said he was proud to be part of the government that legalised abortion.
"What we achieved last night was historic for the New State, which legalized abortion, which is no longer a criminal act, and does not treat abortion women as criminals," he said.

Liu Kun, Minister of Finance: 67 CCTV enterprises and financial institutions have transferred $860.1 billion to supplement the Social Security Fund.

So far, 67 central enterprises and financial institutions have completed the transfer of some state capital to replenish social security funds, transferring a total of 860.1 billion yuan of state capital, Finance Minister Liu Qun said.

Liu Kun made the above statement at the national task deployment meeting on transferring part of state-owned capital to supplement the social security fund jointly convened by the Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security and the SASAC.

"Transferring some of the state capital to replenish the social security fund is an important step to reform and improve the basic old-age insurance system, a full expression of the sharing of the development achievements of state-owned enterprises and the intergenerational fairness of the basic old-age insurance system, and a policy measure based on the current and long-term."

In 2017, the State Council issued an implementation plan for the transfer of part of the state capital to supplement the social security fund, requiring the selection of some central enterprises and some provinces to carry out the pilot project.
According to Liu Kun, positive results have been achieved in the forward work.
At the central level, a total of 67 central enterprises and financial institutions in three batches have been transferred, amounting to some 860.1 billion yuan in state-owned capital.
Of these, the transfer of the central financial institutions to which the Ministry of Finance performs the functions of donor has been basically completed.
Central enterprise transfer has a certain scale.
At the local level, enterprises have started to move forward.
By the end of 2018, the two provinces of Zhejiang and Yunnan had completed pilot work, transferring 15.8 billion yuan of state-owned capital and 18.5 billion yuan of state-owned capital respectively.
In addition to the pilot provinces, other provinces have carried out preliminary preparatory work, laying the foundation for further implementation.

In accordance with the notice issued jointly by the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the State Administration of Assets Administration, the State Administration of Taxation and the Securities Regulatory Commission, the central and local transfer of some state capital to replenish the social security fund will be fully implemented in 2019, and will be completed by 2020.
The meeting held on the same day was a concrete deployment of the full roll-out.
The need for practical and efficient completion of the transfer was emphasized.
According to the schedule, the transfer will be substantially completed by the end of 2020.
Work time is tight and tasks heavy.

Liu said that all regions and departments should carefully organize and carefully arrange to ensure that the transfer work is completed as required; make solid progress, accurately grasp the transfer policy content; and strengthen communication and coordination to solve problems in a timely manner.
From the point of view of "enriching the social security fund", the destination is to provide strong support for old-age security.
However, I think this is not a simple "physical displacement" of equity, but the "mathematical addition".

On September 20, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of People's Social Welfare, the State Administration of Taxation, the State Administration of Taxation, and the Securities Regulatory Commission jointly issued the Circular on the Comprehensive Promotion of the Transfers of Partial State-owned Capital to Enrich the Work of Social Security Funds.
After the publication of the documents, the Ministry of Finance and other departments also quickly implemented.
On September 25, the Ministry of Finance transferred 10% of its holdings in ICBC and Agricultural Bank to the Social Security Fund, with a total value of more than $115 billion.
According to the regulations, as financial investors, the social security foundation and other undertakers enjoy the rights of income, disposition and information.
ICBC and ABC said in their announcement that the changes in equity and equity will not result in changes in the controlling shareholders and actual controllers of the bank.
For this, I think, similar state-owned enterprise equity transfer is not a simple change of ownership, but can stimulate a series of effects of "addition operation".

The first step of the transfer of some state funds to social security “additive results ” is naturally to reflect the ownership of state-owned enterprises by the whole people and the sharing of development results by the whole people.
After years of reform and development, state-owned enterprises (SOEs), especially central enterprises, are mostly in important industries and fields in our economy.
Among them, the leading enterprises are to continue to achieve excellence and strength.
On July 10, the executive meeting of the State Council decided to push back the transfer of some state capital to enrich the work of the social security fund.

The Ministry of Finance immediately stated that it would, together with relevant departments and in accordance with the arrangements made at the executive meetings of the State Council, do a good job of pushing aside and transferring some of the state-owned capital to enrich the work of the social security fund and fully reflect the intergenerational equity of the basic old-age insurance system and the sharing of the fruits of the development of state-owned enterprises.
The second step of the transfer "added result" is to strengthen the sustainability of China's social security fund and further strengthen the foundation of the old-age social security system.
With the aging of the population, China's social security funds are under pressure, and most of the national funds that have been transferred have the ability of continuous profits and dividends.
Estimates show that for every 3.8 percentage points of state capital transferred, the rate of payment of basic old-age insurance can be reduced by 1 percentage point.
The third step of the rotation, the result of addition, is to increase stabilizers for capital markets.
This transfer of the main body to obtain the proceeds is "dividend, operation as a supplement".
As a financial investor of state-owned capital, the social security fund does mainly receive dividend earnings from equity.
However, the social security fund, as a value investor of capital market, has strong ability of capital operation.

With regard to listed assets in state-owned capital, the participation of the social security fund in holding shares will further optimize the governance structure of listed enterprises as legal persons, which will help raise the level of enterprise operation and have a positive impact on listed companies and capital markets.

At the same time, the social security fund as the investment climate vane, the increase of the weight of holdings, is conducive to further enhance its influence in the market, and act as a stabilizer in the market.
In addition, it is also conducive to give full play to the "value discovery" function of institutional investors, guiding investors rational investment, value investment.

Hartmann's funeral concerto was a violin and string concerto when the manuscript of the musical was stolen out of Germany and premiered in Switzerland.

U.S. Senate approves Scalia as labor minister
Washington, September 26 (Xinhua) -- The U.S. Senate voted on President Trump's nomination of Eugene Scalia for labor secretary on September 26.
The vote was 53 to 44, with no Democrats voting for Scalia.
Republicans believe Scalia's CV makes him a perfect fit to be Labor secretary.
But in Democrats "view, Scalia has long stood against workers and unions in his career as a lawyer.
Scalia will replace Alexander Acosta.
Acosta, then labor minister, resigned in July amid mounting public pressure for “leniency ” from Jeffrey Epstein, the US billionaire accused of sexually assaulting and abducting young girls.
Scalia, 56, is a partner in a prominent U.S. law firm whose father is the late U.S. Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia.
The Department of Labor is a cabinet-level department of the United States federal government responsible for labor related matters.
The White House also issued a statement that day saying Trump had nominated Peter Gainer, the acting director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency, to formally lead the agency.
In accordance with the procedure, Gainer's nomination must be approved by the Senate of Congress.

The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), which is part of the Department of Homeland Security, coordinates federal resources to deal with emergencies such as natural disasters and terrorist attacks in the United States.

Iran confirmed to develop advanced centrifuges to further suspend implementation of Iran nuclear deal
The United Nations International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) says Iran has once again violated Iran's nuclear agreement by using advanced centrifuges to enrich uranium.

Iran is reportedly gradually breaking the limits of the Iran nuclear deal in response to US President Donald Trump's withdrawal from the Iran nuclear deal in May 2018, restoring and strengthening sanctions against Iran.
Iran ’ s two other commitments, which were suspended in July, to keep its uranium stock below 300 kg, and its uranium purity below 3.67%, have now been renewed.

Under the nuclear agreement, Iran could only build about 5,000 first-generation IR-1 centrifuges in Natanz to accumulate enriched uranium, and only allow Iran to use a small number of more advanced models for research, but not to produce enriched uranium.
Iran's successful development of more sophisticated centrifuges would allow it to produce enriched uranium at a rate several times faster, possibly for nuclear use.
"On September 25, the agency confirmed that Iran was developing advanced centrifuges of the Type 2 and Model 3... that it was accumulating or ready to accumulate enriched uranium," the report said.

The report was presented to Member States by the United Nations International Atomic Energy Agency, 26 in response to a foreign official saying: "They are busy at the (Natanz enriched uranium) facility."

Italy's education minister has proposed a sugar tax to protect people's health.
Lorenzo Fioramonti, Italy's new cabinet education minister and a member of the Five Star Movement, has proposed to parliament a new tax policy for drinks, snacks and tickets with high sugar content.

It has been reported that the Italian government will impose a snack tax on foods such as sugary drinks and snacks that are harmful to health, as well as an environmental tax on air tickets, a euro for domestic flights and a euro 1.5 euro for international classes, according to a motion for a bill proposed by Education Minister Fiola Monti.
Fiola Monti says the government is expected to receive 3 billion euros in tax revenue through a series of seemingly small tax measures.
The proceeds from this tax will be available for use in the fields of education, health and environmental protection.

In response, Italian Prime Minister Antonio Conte said he thought it was a viable solution, while Italian MP, European MP, and Alliance Party leader Salvini tweeted sarcastically, "Please hide desserts, biscuits, bread and sweets as the new government begins to impose a snack tax."
The snack tax is a special tax on sugary drinks and high-calorie foods, the report said.
The imposition of the tax will help bring benefits to public health.

China's development is an opportunity, not a threat and a challenge to the world.
White Paper: China's development is an opportunity for the world, not a threat or challenge.
The white paper states that China's development is an opportunity, not a threat and a challenge, for the world.

The white paper says that with China's overall national strength and international influence rising rapidly, there are international fears that China will follow the path of “national domination, ” and that some have put forward the so-called“ China threat ”.
These are both cognitive misunderstandings, deep-seated prejudices, psychological imbalances resulting from the power to grow, and deliberate distortions designed to defend their vested interests.

It is both the dream of the Chinese people and the common dream of the people of all countries to realize the prosperity and strength of the country, the revitalization of the nation and the happiness of the people.
"China's development is an opportunity for the world, not a threat and a challenge."

The white paper points out that China is the main stabilizer and power source of world economic growth, that China is the largest contributor to world economic growth, that China's science, technology and innovation inject new kinetic energy into world economic growth, and that in the future the stabilizer and power source of China's economy will become more prominent.
At present, there is not enough impetus for world economic growth.

China's economy is turning from rapid growth to high-quality development.New forms of industrialization, informatization, urbanization and agricultural modernization have been accelerated, the economic structure has been deeply adjusted, industrial optimization has been continuously upgraded, and new economic growth points are emerging.

“The McKinsey Global Institute study suggests that by 2040, China and the rest of the world ’ s economies will have an economic value of $22 trillion to $37 trillion, equivalent to 15% – 26% of the world ’ s total, and that greater cooperation between the rest of the world and China will create significant economic value. ”
The white paper emphasizes that the Chinese economy and the world economy have undergone structural changes and are deeply integrated.
China, which has a more stable economy, a higher quality of growth and a promising growth outlook, is a long-term good for world economic development.

It is neither feasible nor harmful to view China's economic development as a “threat ” and“ challenge, ” and try to push it out of the global industrial chain, supply chain and value chain so that China can “decouple ” from the world economy.
The white paper says opening up to the outside world creates more opportunities for countries to share in the “China dividend. ”
China is firmly committed to a mutually beneficial and win-win strategy of opening up to the outside world, and it has the world's most promising consumer market.
"Openness should be two-way, mutually beneficial, and not one-way, one-way, one-way benefit.
Only mutual benefit can be sustained in the long run.

China is committed to continuously expanding imports, easing market access, improving the business environment and strengthening intellectual property protection, the white paper said, adding that other countries should open up and take corresponding measures to improve their business environment.

Only when all parties act together can an environment of development be created that is open, inclusive, universal, balanced and win-win, and the "cake" of development be made larger and greater together, so as to form a win-win community of interests.
The white paper states that China provides more public goods to the international community.

In a written interview with Xinhua news agency recently, Andrei Slipniov, the general manager of the Russian export center, said Russia is ready to strengthen cooperation with China in the economic and trade field, further optimize the export structure and promote diversification of Russian exports to China.

While forestry, machine manufacturing and chemical industries account for a considerable proportion of Russian exports to China, the export of agricultural products is also important, including oil products, meat products and dairy products, as well as cereals, fish and seafood.
In recent years, Russia's exports of non-raw materials and non-energy products to China have also shown good and stable development.

When it comes to optimizing Russia's export structure to China, he said Russia has set the task of expanding exports of high-tech products to meet the needs of countries and regions in the world, including China, for high-tech products.
Next, Russia will improve financial and non-financial support measures to boost further growth in the number of high-tech companies.

Russia is ready to export construction technology and high-tech construction materials to China and develop cooperation with China in the fields of pharmaceuticals and aviation manufacturing, he said.
Russia and China also have great potential for cooperation in the field of urban environmental development.
He stressed that Russian products in many areas "have a qualitative advantage and are competitive in price" compared with similar products in the West.

Referring to the two countries' goal of achieving $200 billion in bilateral trade volume by 2024, Slipneov said such areas as agriculture, machinery manufacturing, chemical industry and forestry will play an important role in achieving that goal.
The Russian side is interested in diversifying supply in these areas and promoting the export of products of deep processing.
He stressed that the Russian side aims to push its exporters into the global value-added chain, of which China is one.
Russian manufacturers in agriculture, metallurgy, oil and gas, and chemicals are well positioned to participate in the process.
At present, the two countries need to continue to deepen cooperation between their enterprises "to establish more Russian-Chinese joint ventures to jointly develop exports to third countries."

The Russian export center, through the Russian Agency for Export Credit and Investment Insurance and the Russian Export-Import Bank, is taking a variety of measures and services to support Russian exports to China, according to Mr Slipniov.

At the same time, the Russian export center will continue to deepen cooperation with relevant Chinese authorities to promote easy access to the Chinese market for Russian goods and develop new export categories to China.
There has been a marked increase in the global use of RMB payments by financial institutions.
The latest Renminbi Tracker special issue, released in London on 26 July by SWIFT, shows a marked increase in the global use of the yuan to pay financial institutions from July 2017 to July 2019.

At the SWIFT London 2019 annual meeting, the agency ’ s “Renminbi-tracking special issue, ” entitled“ London Insight into the RMB, ” showed that the number of financial institutions using the renminbi increased by 11.31% globally from 1989 to 2,214 in July 2017.
Africa and the Middle East saw the largest increase in the number of institutions paying in renminbi, from 143 in July 2017 to 173 in July 2019, an increase of 20.98%.
As of August 2019, the renminbi ’ s share of the global payment currency was 2.22%, according to the report.
Meanwhile, London is playing a leading role in the yuan's offshore foreign exchange transactions.
According to the report, London ’ s share of global offshore exchange transactions in the renminbi was 33.79% in July 2019, the world ’ s largest.
London is firmly at the top of global foreign exchange trading, the report said.
In July 2019, London ’ s share of global foreign exchange transactions was 40.14%, with 12.93% in the US and 7.67% in France.

Hong Kong Government launches free special training programme to help financially affected employees in the near future

The HKSAR Government announced on Tuesday that it would introduce a free special training scheme for employees affected by recent economic conditions. Eligible trainees will receive a monthly training allowance of up to HK $4,000 upon completion of their courses.
Many boutiques in Hong Kong's Tsim Sha Tsui Harbour have few customers.
As a result of recent social strife in Hong Kong, there has been a sharp drop in visitors to Hong Kong, affecting the hospitality, catering and retail sectors.

The Secretary for Labour and Welfare, Mr Alan Lo Chun-kwong and the Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development, Mr Edward Yau, commissioned the Employees Retraining Board to launch a special training programme and to meet with the media on measures to support the tourism industry.
Mr Lo said the challenges facing Hong Kong's economy were urgent and should not wait until the situation was calm.
Therefore, the HKSAR Government has launched a free training programme called "Special? Value Added".

People who have lost their jobs since June 1 or have been asked to take unpaid leave by their employers will have the opportunity to participate in the scheme as long as the relevant requirements are met, it said.

Mr Lo said the curriculum was broad in scope. The most important part of the programme was the training of "vocational skills", covering 19 sectors, including tourism, retail and catering. There would also be a number of new "innovative technologies" courses and cross-industry "generic skills" courses.
The Chairman of the Employees Retraining Council, Mr Yu Pengchun, said that all courses were free of charge and that the scheme was expected to support about 10,000 people in need.
Each participant who completes a full-time or part-time programme and has a attendance rate of 80% will receive a special allowance up to HK $4,000 per month.

According to the report, the courses will be offered for two to three months by some 50 training institutes. They can be read in the daily newspapers from October 3 to March 31, with a maximum of four courses per person.
In addition, the HKSAR Government has announced a series of measures to support the tourism industry to help the industry overcome the difficulties.
These measures include relaxing the allocation to the Tourism Industry Council, subsidising 6,000 tour guides to enrol in courses and waiving annual fees for travel agents.
Exercise tiresome, too?
A study of athletes showed that after intense exercise, the brain also showed signs of fatigue, according to the Russian Satellite Network.

The study, led by Mathias Perciglión, a specialist at the Petier-Salperture Hospital in France, showed a less obvious link between mental and manual labour: both required cognitive control of activity.
"You need to control the autonomous process that can force yourself to stop when you have muscle and joint pain," Perciglion explained.
The study was launched by France's National Institute of Sport (INSEP).
The school's experts are responsible for guiding athletes in their preparations for the Olympics.
Some athletes have begun to develop overtraining syndrome, an irrepressible fatigue after high loads of exercise, a physical inability to recover and a decline in performance.
INSEP raises the question of whether part of this illness is due to nerve fatigue, the kind of neurological fatigue that results from excessive mental labor?
The study was published in the journal Current Biology.

Xinhua News Agency Beijing, September 27 (Xinhua) -- The People's Bank of China (PBOC) conducted 30 billion yuan counter-repurchase operation by way of interest rate tender.
Due to the fact that 40 billion yuan of reverse buyback expired on that day, the People's Bank of China realized 10 billion yuan of reverse buyback operation.

Let Chinese Citizens Go Out More Reliable - Visit Choi Ai-min, Head of Consular Affairs Department, Ministry of Foreign Affairs
Wherever you go, your country is behind you.
On the 25th, the first Ministry of Foreign Affairs Consular Protection public service video on the line, the short film ends this sentence resonated with the general netizens.

In an interview with Xinhua News Agency, Choi Ai-min, the head of the Consular Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said the short film was intended to make people feel more "diplomatic in the interests of the people", so that Chinese citizens would feel that, wherever they were in the world, Chinese diplomats would help them and give them help, strength and hope.
There is no such thing as peace abroad.

In the past 70 years, the number of Chinese citizens "going out" has increased sharply, from less than one million a year before the reform and opening-up policies to more than one million a year today, said Mr. Cui.

According to statistics, since the 18th National Party Congress, we have organized more than 10 major actions to evacuate or transfer Chinese citizens abroad, and have safely evacuated more than 40,000 Chinese citizens from dangerous and volatile areas.
Some 500,000 cases involving nearly 1 million Chinese citizens have been handled and handled in a coordinated manner.
In times of danger, the motherland can take you home; a "walking trip" is no longer a dream.
By the end of August, China had concluded visa-free agreements with 14 countries covering ordinary passport holders, according to Mr. Choi.
In addition, more and more countries have unilaterally granted Chinese citizens visa-free or visa-free entry facilities.

Forty-two countries and regions, including Thailand and Egypt, have unilaterally granted visa-landing visas to Chinese citizens with regular passports, while 15 countries and regions, including Indonesia, have unilaterally granted visa-free entry to Chinese citizens with regular passports.
In addition to the arrangements for granting visas without visa or landing, Chinese citizens have become more and more convenient and simplified in applying for visas.
By the end of August, China had concluded agreements or arrangements for simplified visa procedures with 41 countries.

These include agreements with the United States, Canada, Israel and Argentina to issue 10 years of valid multiple visas for tourism and business personnel, and with the United Kingdom to issue 2 years of visa arrangements for tourism, business and family visitors.
The United Kingdom and Belgium jointly launched a one-stop visa service, with France, Italy and Singapore shortening the processing time to 48 hours, 36 hours and 24 hours, respectively.
For business people who often leave the country, the APEC Business Travel Card, which has multiple entry and convenient customs clearance, is a good choice.
According to Cui, holding the travel card is equivalent to obtaining visas from 16 economies around Asia and the Pacific for more than five years.
At present, China ranks first among APEC economies in terms of effective card holding.

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs will actively negotiate bilateral reciprocal agreements on visas, urge more countries to adopt visa facilitation measures for Chinese citizens, and turn diplomatic achievements into more beneficial and convenient measures for the benefit of the Chinese people.

Fujian provincial tax bank silver convenient people integrated tax payment platform official online - Zhongxin net
Fujian provincial tax bank silver convenient integrated tax payment platform is officially on line.
Fuzhou September 27 (Ye Qiuyun) Fujian provincial tax bank silver convenient people integrated tax payment platform September 27 Fujian Province Fuzhou City officially launched.

On October 26, 2018, the central branch of the People's Bank of China in Fuzhou, in conjunction with the State Administration of Taxation, Fujian Provincial Taxation Administration, and China UnionPay Co., Ltd. signed a tripartite memorandum of cooperation to create an integrated tax payment platform for the silver bank in Fujian Province.
After nearly a year of construction, the platform has been successfully put on line.

Wang Dehui, Director of the Treasury Department of Fuzhou Central Branch of the People's Bank of China, said that the platform adheres to the concept of security, versatility, convenience, conformity and leading construction. The platform is connected with the taxation, government, bank, non-bank payment agencies and social service parties.

It is reported that the platform brings together a number of projects for the benefit of the people, among which, the urban and rural residents health care fee collection project has officially come online.
The project opened up 14 channels offline to serve more than 30 million urban and rural residents in Fujian, covering 76% of Fujian ’ s resident population.
It is possible to pay health insurance fees by means of "flash payment" and APP, microcredential public numbers of banks.

While ensuring direct government revenue collection and real-time interaction of data and information, the platform can provide safe, efficient, multi-channel, and multi-mode public service for the payment of taxes.

So far, more than 9,000 of the province's more than 16,000 universal financial services points have opened up the function of checking and paying medical insurance premiums, so that rural residents can safely check and pay medical insurance fees if they don't get out of their villages.

According to statistics, in the 20 days since the initial trial run of the medical insurance fee payment for urban and rural residents on the platform, the service users have reached 840,000, of which 750,000 have paid online, and nearly 20,000 have paid at universal financial service points.

In addition, the State Administration of Taxation in Fujian Province tax bureau deputy director Lin GuoMirror at the event revealed that the platform in the country pioneered the application of blockchain electronic payment certificate technology.
Starting next month, the payer will be able to download the stamped electronic payment voucher directly through the mobile phone after completing the payment.
Fujian tax information network based on blockchain technology is being built, and the "highway" of private tax payment will be further widened.

Two kinds of high pressure project operation
26, the quasi-east to southern Anhui ± 1100 kV HVDC transmission project, Sutong 1000 kV AC GIL integrated pipeline project.

Both of these projects occupy the current world transmission technologies in their respective fields of production and transportation, which will greatly enhance the large-scale optimization of energy distribution in China.
Guo Zhi, chief economist of the National Energy Bureau, said the quasi-easterly to southern Anhui project is the world's largest transmission capacity, transmission distance.
It is of great significance to promote the development of Xinjiang energy base and guarantee the power supply in East China.
GIL is a gas-insulated metal closed transmission line.
The Su Tong Pipe Gallery project has created the highest global voltage level and the strongest transmission capacity of the GIL project.
According to the State Grid Company, the quasi-easterly to southern Anhui engineering transmission distance is 3,324 kilometers.

Foreign Exchange Bureau: China's external debt structure continuously optimized the external debt stability enhancement
"Overall, China's external debt structure continues to be optimized, the stability of foreign debt is enhanced.

Wang Chunying, press spokesman and chief economist of the State Administration of Foreign Exchange, said the main indicators of China's foreign debt are within the internationally recognized security line.
Wang Chunying made this statement in response to questions from reporters when the foreign exchange bureau published data on external debt at the end of June 2019.

According to the data, at the end of June 2019, China ’ s total foreign debt balance (including domestic and foreign currencies) stood at $19.8 billion, an increase of $26.3 billion, or 1.3%, from the end of March 2019, mainly due to an increase in debt securities balances.

In the second quarter of 2019, more than 70% of China's total foreign debt increase was driven by the purchase of domestic RMB bonds by non-residents, and the majority of non-residents are medium- and long-term investors such as the central bank.

At the end of June 2019, the share of medium- and long-term foreign debt increased by 3 percentage points compared to the end of March 2019, and the share of domestic foreign debt increased by 1 percentage point compared to the end of March 2019.

Wang said that with the inclusion of RMB bonds into the Bloomberg Barclays Global Composite Index in April 2019, international investors in the Chinese bond market further increased their recognition and continued to increase domestic RMB bonds.
"China's balance of payments maintain overall balance, external debt risk can be controlled."
Reporter 27 learned from Yunnan Agricultural Academy, Yunnan grassland is now effective prevention and control, did not cause widespread outbreak, prevention and control work has achieved milestones.

In January this year, Jiangcheng County, Yunnan Pu'er City, saw for the first time the migration from outside the country of the grassland Moth, subsequently confirmed in 129 counties in Yunnan Province.

It is an important agricultural pest in the tropical and subtropical areas of the Americas. It is a major migratory pest in the global warning of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.
The pest harms more than 80 kinds of crops such as maize, sugar cane and sorghum.
It is difficult to prevent and control, there is no registered pesticide in China.

Since the invasion of Yunnan, Yunnan Agricultural Academy has selected Chen Eidong Fellow, led Yunnan Agricultural Academy of Agriculture Cross-border Pest together with Green Prevention and Control Provincial Innovation Team to go to the front line, field survey, collect samples, and conduct technical guidance and test demonstration.

Chen Eidong's team has mastered the population characteristics of Yunnan grassland, natural enemy insect resources, overseas insect origin, population migration trajectory, drug toxicity and field control.

Through the implementation of new green control technologies such as population monitoring, adult insect booby traps, scientific drug use and agricultural measures, they have achieved more than 90% in the demonstration area, reduced the use of chemical pesticides, protected natural enemy resources and ecological environment, and provided technical guarantee for Yunnan to effectively control the outbreak and sustainable management of the grassland moths.
At present, Yunnan grassland greedy nocturnal moth has been effectively controlled, has not caused a large area outbreak, prevention and control work has achieved some results.
Next, Yunnan Agricultural Academy will focus on the ecological mechanism of population migration and invasion, break through biological control and green control system.

Meanwhile, we will actively promote cross-border international cooperation and seek to establish joint key laboratories and joint monitoring network sites and demonstration areas abroad, so as to enhance the overall monitoring and early warning capabilities of Yunnan grasslands.

Forty-five national and regional textile representatives jointly issued the World Trade Declaration.
At the 2019 World Trade Fair held in Koqiao District, Shaoxing City, Zhejiang Province, representatives from 45 countries and regions jointly issued the World Trade Declaration.

The declaration states that, facing the future, the countries concerned will jointly promote the high-quality development of the world textile industry by adhering to open coordination, scientific and technological drive and fashion leap.

The World Trade Congress brought together about 1,200 representatives of the textile industry from 45 countries and regions to explore the sustainable development and win-win cooperation of the world textile industry in light of the trends in the world economy.
Sun Ruizhe, president of the Chinese Textile Industry Federation, said the current pattern of division of labor, trade and innovation in global industries is undergoing profound readjustment.
